showerReviews.reviewText:
Pool area has recently been refurbished however shower and changing area remains dirty and usually always has a stench, cleanliness is not prioritised here, one week I found feacal matter smeared on the toilet roll holder in the female toilets.
As if this wasn‚Äôt awful enough, my 4 year old,  amongst others in the same class, was left in tears for 2 weeks in a row by the same teacher. I went to reception to complain only to be told to move sessions to a different day. Very sad that my child will no longer be using the services here due to staff who clearly aren‚Äôt bothered about customer complaints or cleanliness of this place.
showerReviews.author: Sophia

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staff are friendly and classes are good.
Unfortunately, I had dropped two starts because the parking space is very limited. Though there is a big area beside the centre which I don't know why the council doesn't give access to it for parking.
The second issue is the showers in the pool area, which some of it is broken, and it takes months to fix. Besides this, the number of women only swimming sessions is not enough, and most of the time, it is fully booked.
Would be great to add more sessions or extend the swimming time so working mums can swim while kids are sleep at home.
showerReviews.author: Fatemeh Donya

showerReviews.reviewText:
am writing to file a serious complaint regarding the way I was treated during my first visit to your facility today.

After paying ¬£6.50 at reception, I received no guidance or explanation on how to use the facilities. I had to ask other people where to go because your staff gave me no information.

Later, when I asked about using the steam sauna, a staff member told me I hadn‚Äôt paid. I explained that the receptionist had not informed me about any extra cost, and I offered to pay right away. However, instead of helping me, they told me to leave the area ‚Äî even though I was wet and had already been swimming. The way they spoke to me was rude and disrespectful. They treated me with no basic courtesy, and not a single person apologized for the confusion.

I felt humiliated. I was spoken to harshly, pushed out before I could even rinse off properly, and made to feel unwelcome. It felt like I was being treated less than human. I don‚Äôt know if this was because I am a foreigner, but the way I was treated makes me feel that there was discrimination involved. It was completely unacceptable.

Let me be clear: the facilities are clean and well-maintained, and the environment itself is nice. But the customer service I experienced was extremely poor and unprofessional. Your staff need urgent training in how to treat people with respect, especially new visitors who don‚Äôt yet know the system.

I hope you take this complaint seriously. I expect a proper response and an apology.
showerReviews.author: H Weldu

showerReviews.reviewText:
Everywhere smells like urine and vomit.

They have a long drain passing through the hallway of the changing room that‚Äôs visibly clogged to the brim with old hair and what smells like urine and fecal matter.

This place has massive health concerns. It‚Äôs very hard to breathe and absolutely stinks.

They really need to clean the changing area. There must be massive problems coming from upper management to not address this glaring problem for the 4 months that I‚Äôve been visiting.

The reviews before me don‚Äôt highlight this enough, but all the other members I‚Äôve talk to about this place have the same complaints.

I leave this negative review with good intention and hope things will change.

Hire professional deep cleaning services - one time - for one day - atleast. Get rid of the clogged hair everywhere. Please.
showerReviews.author: Russell Sammut Bonnici

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant facilities for wobbly wanderers and wheelchair users.

Changing facilities include shower room with a hoist and waterproof bed and an accessible shower for independent wheelchair users, shower chair and toilets with grab rails for safety.

Staff are trained with poolside equipment and doors open at the push of a button or are lightweight enough for wheelchair users to pass through without difficulty.

Unlike Sandwell facilities this is very accessible and I recommend disabled Sandwell tenants visit Birmingham facilities for safety

#shamesmbc

showerReviews.reviewText:
The gym has a nice view and the space overall feels fine. It‚Äôs accessible and there‚Äôs a parking area nearby, which is definitely a plus.

However, I only used the pool once, and unfortunately, the smell in the changing room was really unpleasant ‚Äî like urine ‚Äî which honestly put me off. I even reported it to the staff at the time.

After almost a year, I decided to cancel my membership. Be aware that even after you pay for a full month, your membership won‚Äôt be cancelled right away. You still have to pay for the following month before the cancellation takes effect, which I personally found frustrating and unfair.

Overall, the gym has some good points, but these issues made me reconsider continuing my membership.
showerReviews.author: Mona

showerReviews.reviewText:
Ever dreamt of a competition on who gets the most diseases? This centre is your place! It's incredibly dirty, looks like the cleaner vanished long time ago.

Plus, there's no separate space for men and women, so you can practice your courage by changing your clothes in a cubicle while hearing men talk! And everyone's staring while you dry your hair with those flimsy dryers will definitely boost your confidence!
showerReviews.author: Andreea Stres

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄãI am writing to express my profound dissatisfaction with the management and organisation at the center, particularly concerning the use of the shower facilities.
‚ÄãDespite registering my children partly because of the availability of shower rooms as feature I expected to offer comfort and convenience for my daughter. the reality has been a frustrating lack of adherence to rules.
‚ÄãSpecifically:
‚ÄãParents are 'booking' showers by leaving towels or bags while their children are still in the pool, resulting in a chaotic 'race' for space. This poor etiquette forces other children to shiver unnecessarily.
‚ÄãThe management has been unresponsive to my repeated complaints. It appears they are indifferent to conflicts among members and the enforcement of basic rules.
‚ÄãStaff members often disappear at the end of sessions, which is precisely when supervision is needed most to ensure orderly shower use.
‚ÄãI recommend implementing clear signage on shower doors or posting a staff member near the shower area at the end of sessions to enforce proper procedure.
‚ÄãThe center itself is a nice facility, but the poor organisation and absent management have created a dysfunctional environment. Due to this chaos, I have cancelled my children's membership and will not re-enroll them in this center may be suitable for adults, but it is not appropriate for children under current operational standards.
showerReviews.author: Rose Amrani

showerReviews.reviewText: While the facilities are lovely, the lifeguards don't enforce rules and are too relaxed about swimming periods. Me and my partner attended a 2 hour lane swimming session and had both a parent teach her child that took up half on the space of a lane, meaning a lot of swimmers had to stop early or swim around her. They weren't lame swimming and the lifeguards were aware and didn't do anything. Later in the session there were 2 schoolchildren who had a inflatable ball and kept splashing around and getting in people's way. At one point all the other swimmers were just doing half laps to avoid the pair as they were so disruptive. It's such a shame that the lifeguards can't enforce the rules as we're all paying guests.
showerReviews.author: Scott Farquharson

locations.title: Sparkhill Pool & Fitness Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàStratford Rd, Birmingham B11 4EA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall, Sparkhill Pool is a really nice facility ‚Äî the pool itself is clean, well-maintained, and I‚Äôve genuinely enjoyed coming here for lessons over the past few months. I‚Äôve made great progress and now feel confident swimming in deep water. I‚Äôve even swum the full length of the pool with my husband during mixed sessions without any issues.
However, during the women-only sessions, I‚Äôve found the attitude of some lifeguards quite disappointing. One in particular has been rude and unreasonably strict. When I tried to explain that I feel confident swimming in the deep end, I was told that if I continued going there, I would be banned unless I took more lessons. This feels unfair and comes across as a way of pushing people to spend more money rather than supporting their progress.
I completely understand the importance of safety, but lifeguards should also be polite, professional, and encouraging. Their role is to ensure safety ‚Äî not to discourage capable swimmers who have put in the effort to learn. A more respectful and understanding approach would make the experience much better for everyone.
showerReviews.author: javaria irfan

showerReviews.reviewText:
Womens gym good, not that big but equipment is good, nothing fancy. Lots of ladies classes available although some turn on the music way too loudly. Sauna is nice.
Ladies swimming (main reason I joined): it's not lane swimmers friendly, the only time where you can swim nicely is at 9pm which I think is too late. All other sessions are learning and kids hang out sides. They leave a tiny lane for the ladies who actually want to lane swim and its not very pleasant as its too narrow and difficult to overtake.  Most sessions are also always completely full and it's difficult to get a slot, you have to wait for cancellations on the day. Also, they pack us like sardines which makes it worse, I remember one time 9am it was lane swimmers and there were like 5 lanes or so and was super crowded.
I think more ladies sessions should be added as they're clearly very popular but the managers responses to the raised issued fell on deaf ears. Moved to another venue now with purley lane swimmers hamdulillah.
Since swimming was the main reason for joining I give 2 stars, the other gym stuff is Good and if u don't care about swimming ull be fine.
showerReviews.author: Mikasa Zoldyck

showerReviews.reviewText:
The ladies only exercise classes have fantastic teachers, especially Jennifer and Maria. Their energy and positivity are infectious and they make working out fun.

There are not enough risers for everyone during some classes, or enough small mats, which is not fair for people who have booked and aren‚Äôt able to do the exercise in the same way as everyone else. I had to use the last mat which was broken in half, while some went without. Some of the regulars will push past you to grab extra things for themselves without any consideration for others. Instructors are not strict enough to people hogging extra items of equipment or for people sneaking into classes who have not booked. Please invest in some more equipment so there is enough for a full class.

The hygiene could also also be improved. I‚Äôm not sure the mats and weights are ever cleaned in the studio. The spray for people to clean them themselves has been empty for weeks.
showerReviews.author: Moonie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Every time I go to lane swimming there's always groups of women not swimming just chatting. Blocking the entire wall so there's no where to turn. Lane swimming with no turn point is not a full length. It's really frustrating and the life guards never move them to the area of the pool where people aren't trying to swim lengths. Swimming lanes should only be for people who are swimming.
The changing rooms are grim and often smell strongly of urine. The floors are filthy.
The showers might as well not be there and are always too hot or cold.
The pool itself isn't too bad, it's just ruined by the unaddressed behaviour of others.

showerReviews.reviewText: Decent sized swimming pool. Decent refreshments too. Generally clean but the family chaning smelt like urine. Half of the showers dont work, the hairdryers dont work and the slide was out of action for half of our visit (had to call maintenance half way through the session). The waves also didnt work on first attempt, maintenance had to attend to that too - the waves did come on in the end. Staff are polite and helpful, some general fixes and deeper cleaning would make all the difference to the experience. We will be back as my daughter loves the plunge pool slide, it's an acceptable morning out. The little park just outside the baths is small but functional. Car park is large and always busy.
showerReviews.author: Emily Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been using this centre for some years now but lately it's gone down. I use swimming pool only and the cleanliness of wet and dry areas is poor. Dirty floors, dirty changing cubicles and clumps of hair in the shower drain. I don't understand the 'no outerwear' signs all around where 'the outer'is much cleaner than inside and who in their right mind would walk barefoot on those disgusting floors? Toilets are tired, with broken cubicle locks and dirty floor that could really use a pressure washer. Recently changed showerheads have very low water pressure and the water is either scorching hot or freezing cold, nothing in between. Hair dryers in ladies changing room either broken or removed.There's only few towel hangers, some lockers inside are truly disgusting, no benches to leave your bag while you shower and nobody thought to install some shampoo holders by showers, so you have to keep everything on the floor. As for the swimming area itself, the pool is big and deep, good for doing the lengths. They removed tables and benches recently so it doesn't look very inviting and the floor tiles again need a proper scrub. My main issue there is that there's lots of debris floating in the water, the foamy bits from the equipment and I've never seen any staff trying to fish it out. I even saw a plaster floating there once!
On the plus side the staff are very friendly and helpful and the car park is spacious, so 2 * for this.
showerReviews.author: Joa G

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely shocking and unprofessional experience.
Today I tried over 20 times to call Lashurit Centre in Northfield to ask about swimming lessons for my child. Most of the time my calls were actively rejected. On the two occasions they actually answered, as soon as I started asking a question, they hung up the phone on me.
No explanation. No apology. Just hanging up on a potential customer.
I also sent an email and, unsurprisingly, received no response at all.
This is not how a professional business behaves. If you cannot answer basic enquiries or treat people with basic respect, you should seriously reconsider working with the public. Parents trust swimming centres with their children‚Äôs safety ‚Äî and this level of communication is completely unacceptable.
I would strongly advise others to think twice before dealing with a centre that ignores, rejects, and disconnects calls instead of helping customers.

They block the pool by walking up and down the shallow end as if they own it, and then swim uncomfortably close to you, often crashing into you. They're also very fond of shouting 'helpful' instructions to women but strangely not other men. Unfortunately the staff appear powerless to do anything about them.

showerReviews.reviewText: Very unsuitable for someone swimming for fitness, there are three lanes which is usually ok but there is no control of the skill level in each lane from the lifeguards which makes the experience a lot more difficult (I.e people who should be in the slow lane blocking the whole fast lane). The activity sessions like aqua aerobics takes up 2/3 of the pool and everyone who‚Äôs booked lane swimming (around 30 people) are forced into 1 lane. This shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to happen on the booking system. I get strikes on my account for no apparent reason (every time I arrive I have to get the staff to remove the strike), the car park is tiny and never has any space, made worse than the cones which make it impossible to turn and use the few and far between spaces there are left. The changing rooms constantly smell of urine which I have heard other members complain about. Would not recommend :(
showerReviews.author: Charles Bush

showerReviews.reviewText: Very unsuitable for someone swimming for fitness, there are three lanes which is usually ok but there is no control of the skill level in each lane from the lifeguards which makes the experience a lot more difficult (I.e people who should be in the slow lane blocking the whole fast lane). locations.title: University of Birmingham Sport & Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉàUniversity of, Bristol Rd, Edgbaston, Birmingham B15 2TT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very poor value for money and extremely disappointing management.

The membership fee is very high (¬£58 per month), yet the facilities are quite limited. During the summer, parts of the facilities were closed for maintenance for around two months, which significantly affected normal use. No compensation or fee reduction was offered.

Staff attitude is another major issue. Interactions felt cold, dismissive and unhelpful, especially when raising reasonable questions about membership or cancellation.

The swimming pool is frequently occupied by large groups of children attending lessons, which makes it extremely difficult for adult members to use the pool properly. This is not clearly communicated in advance.

Before joining, the service was presented very positively during enquiries, and the website advertises a wide range of ‚Äúfree‚Äù classes and activities. In reality, despite paying ¬£58 per month, many of these classes are not available to book or are extremely restricted. This feels misleading once you have already committed and paid.

Despite not using the facilities for over six months, I was not allowed to cancel my membership without paying an additional month‚Äôs fee. There was no flexibility at all, even in cases of non-use or relocation.

Overall, the experience feels highly transactional and unfair. I would strongly encourage others to be cautious, read the terms carefully, and think twice before joining.
showerReviews.author: xiuxiu han

locations.title: The Gym Group Birmingham Broad Street
locations.address: ÓÉàGround Floor, The Broadway Residences, Broad Street Part, Birmingham B16 8HA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have been training here for six months now, and it is easily the best-kept, best‚Äëequipped gym available around the ¬£20 price point.

Other chains charge much more, yet their machines are often out of order, dirty, or poorly maintained, whereas here the equipment is consistently clean, well‚Äëlubricated, and ready to use.

I have tried four different gym brands across the UK and this one is by far the most reasonable and the one I recommend the most.

The hygiene standards are excellent, and you never see broken machines sitting there for weeks waiting to be fixed.

Special mention to the staff member who looks like Arthur Shelby with a moustache, he keeps the place spotless and the free weights always neatly organised.

Would highly recommend this gym over the competition, whether you are just starting out or are an experienced lifter looking for a reliable place to train.
showerReviews.author: samad ahmed

1st floor is mostly cardio, and upper body focused.

Trainers are friendly and helpful enough.
They‚Äôve got lockers for both male and female and a posing room.
Closing time is 12 am on Monday to Saturday, usually staff are present till 9pm each weekday, after which you‚Äôll need a membership code to enter the building.
A swimming pool would have given it a straight 5 star.
However, it‚Äôs a lovely gym and the staff are friendly

showerReviews.reviewText:
After the reply from owner, I felt I should explain my rating as written on 3-11-20.

First: The covid prevention measure are 5 stars. The gym had done what they can as you can see from of the pictures. What can be done, had been done. Therefore, I felt relative safe given the cirumstances.

However, I had been in this gym for 2 years, and what really degrade my overall score is building maintaince and resistant training equipments. Over time, I have seen water leaks, that took quite a long time to fix. The male change room was actually shorten with a new wall to cover the old toilets. The water pressure for the wash basin are way to high.
Next is the resistant facilities. I felt for a gym of this size, with the amount of gym goers even during mild period, there are not enough power racks, benches, and free weights. During peak hours, I dont even bother with any of the benches. In comparison with gyms from city centre/downtown in other parts of the world, I do not believe there are enough power racks, press benches, regular benches, free weights, etc.

Thos are 2 reasons I give this gym a rating of 3, which have nothing to do with COVID-19.

But with that being said, I still go to this gym due to geographical location. I just wish the building is maintain better, and the weights sections are better invested. But if you are into cardio, you probably never have to waits for any of the machines. There are like more than a hundread of cardios machines from all kinds of bikes, to tread, to steps, to row.

3/5 as of 3-11-20. But good enough for me to go nevertheless.
showerReviews.author: Felix Kwok

But with that being said, I still go to this gym due to geographical location. I just wish the building is maintain better, and the weights sections are better invested. But if you are into cardio, you probably never have to waits for any of the machines. There are like more than a hundread of cardios machines from all kinds of bikes, to tread, to steps, to row.

3/5 as of 3-11-20. But good enough for me to go nevertheless.
showerReviews.author: Felix Kwok

locations.title: 24/7 Fitness - Birmingham West Gym
locations.address: ÓÉàHagley Rd, Bearwood, Birmingham B66 4AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been a member of this gym on and off for the past 16 years ‚Äî back when it was Fitness First, it was brilliant. Unfortunately, since the new management took over, the quality and maintenance have gone drastically downhill.

The changing rooms are consistently dirty, and in the ladies‚Äô section, half the machines don‚Äôt work. The treadmills that do work often have faults. When I rejoined a few months ago, the sauna was ‚Äúout of order,‚Äù and I was told it would be fixed soon ‚Äî six months later, it‚Äôs still out of order.

When I‚Äôve tried to raise these concerns with staff, I‚Äôm met with shrugs and ‚Äúit is what it is.‚Äù For a gym charging ¬£26 a month, that‚Äôs simply not acceptable. Other gyms in the same price range, like JD and PureGym, maintain much higher standards.

There are also basic facilities that have been neglected: no hairdryers for women anymore, showers that take ages to warm up (if at all), and fewer working showers due to boarded-off sections. To top it off, yesterday there was a bucket in front of the ladies‚Äô gym to catch a leak.

The only reason I rejoined was because of the 24/7 opening hours, but at this point, convenience isn‚Äôt enough to justify the poor experience. I really hope management takes this feedback seriously and restores the gym to the standards it once had.
showerReviews.author: Anisa Mahmood

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been going to Wyndley for 35+ years, but it‚Äôs changed little in the decades. It‚Äôs pretty basic inside, but it looks tired and is in obvious need for repair in several areas.

The mixed changing rooms especially are pretty tired and rather dirty.

Attending recently they‚Äôve been in a dire state, with people wearing outdoor shoes even into the pool areas unchallenged I noticed which is just rude and very unhygienic. The floors as a result are often filthy, to be quite honest, with even the poolside drains being caked in black/brown water.

It does what it says on the tin with no fanfare but I can‚Äôt recommend it.

EDIT: dropped it down to 1* following another visit. 9am on a Sunday, child‚Äôs pool was already filthy.

Ceiling tiles in the mixed sex changing rooms were missing and brown water was leaking into the changing facilities from the above pipework. No idea what those pipes contained, could have been anything. Obviously pretty important to ensure health and safety control in a swimming baths!

Baby and toddler classes are NOT baby and toddler. Reception, whilst friendly, were unable to help when I mentioned parents had brought their 4/5+ y/o children into the baths and were thus making it impossible to safely introduce my small baby to swimming.

Will never be going again, and I suggest nobody else does until they knock it all down and build something new.
showerReviews.author: Rhys D

showerReviews.reviewText: The parking was easily accessed with plenty of spaces. My children and I were there to attend a pool party. Changing cubicles were spacious that led to the swimming pools. A swimming test was performed to see whether life jackets were required. The children had the option to go on the giant inflatable or the shallow pool with plenty of floats and weights to keep them entertained. Life guards were present in case of emergency and went into action when a child required assistance. Unfortunately, the viewing galleries were not available, as one had a party in place (later became available), and the other there was some work being done on the roof. They accommodated enabling parents to sit next to the pool that was very warm at times. Overall, the children had a great time with lovely friends, and we're part of a beautiful birthday celebration üéÇüéàü™Ö
showerReviews.author: Marsinah Higgins

locations.title: Moseley Road Baths
locations.address: ÓÉàMoseley Road Pools, 497 Moseley Rd, Balsall Heath, Birmingham B12 9BX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only grade II listed pool in the whole West Midlands?

This is a fantastic place to go back in time and celebrate one of the most historic buildings and classic architecture in Birmingham. Just less than 5-7 minutes drive from central Birmingham on a good traffic day, this pool is located on Alcester Road with good bus links or a Uber ride away.

The pool has changing rooms, toilets and showers all around it allowing you to be comfortable and staying in the same space.

The staff are super friendly and amazing. This week as I have been told is the last week before the big refurb and the Moseley Baths will be closed until Spring 2025.

Definitely a must visit if you are visiting Birmingham and I am most definitely looking forward to visit Birmingham once it is open again.
showerReviews.author: N Walayat

showerReviews.reviewText:
Visited these baths for a dip during my stay at Moseley.

It's in urgent need of TLC. I felt like I was back in time, Victorian era to be precise. The cleanliness was non existent as it was icky and sticky. No showers before nor after which added to the 3rd world feel.

The private cubicles were the best thing about it. I wouldn't say shut this place down, just burn it to the ground and from the watery ashes, build a better swimming bath.
showerReviews.author: The Visitor

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of several gyms over the years, but this one truly stands out. The cleanliness of the facility is impeccable. Every corner of the gym, from the workout areas to the locker rooms, is spotless. This high standard of hygiene is particularly reassuring in the pool area, which is always crystal clear and well-maintained.

The modern equipment is another highlight. The gym is outfitted with the latest machines and weights, ensuring that every workout is efficient and enjoyable. Whether you‚Äôre into cardio, strength training, or a bit of both, the variety and quality of the equipment make it easy to find what you need.

What truly makes this gym exceptional, though, are the instructors. They are knowledgeable, friendly, and always willing to help. Their classes are engaging and challenging, providing the perfect balance of motivation and support.

The only downside I‚Äôve encountered is the limited space for free workouts. While the gym excels in many areas, the designated area for free workout and stretching can get a bit crowded during peak hours. there is just enough space for 3 people and it's cramped in the corner, surrounded by machines. However, this is a minor inconvenience compared to the overall high standards maintained in the facility.

Overall, this gym is an excellent place to achieve your fitness goals. The cleanliness, modern equipment, and outstanding instructors make it a top choice. If they could just expand the free workout space a bit, it would be perfect!
showerReviews.author: Compulsive Baker

showerReviews.reviewText: Droitwich are lucky to have a beautiful lido in their town. I visited this morning and shared the pool with one other swimmer. I‚Äôm not sure the water temp was 22¬∞ as the sign stated? The pool, surrounding areas and changing rooms were spotlessly clean. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. I‚Äôd booked the 13:30 slot ( I was travelling North) but arrived earlier and was able to swim at the earlier time. The showers did take some time to run warm. A lovely cafe is next to the pool. After my swim I enjoyed a toasted sausage sandwich and coffee. Friendly staff here too! A fabulous asset for the town.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The park itself is brilliant! Free parking available in certain car parks. The park seems very well maintained, and the variety in the playgrounds is great, my kids loved it!

There is a massive outdoor pool with a really fun splash pad for the kids. Be under no illusion however, the pool is cold, VERY cold! It was too cold for my two young boys of 5 and 3, although it was packed with people which it didn't seem to bother, so that might be just us! We went on a day it was around 27C weather as well.

Facilities are alright, changing rooms a little grimy, but not terrible. A few benches dotted around for seating, but when it's packed it can be difficult.

There is a cafe on-site which sells quite a bit and looked decent.
showerReviews.author: Dow Ninja Gaming

showerReviews.reviewText: Very good value for money. As a gym member one has swimming included & can use other locations at no extra cost. The only issue I have is the lighting is quite appalling in the Ashby location. It's way too harsh & when lying back pressing dumbells it's blinding which could be considered hazardous if lifting heavier weights. Hence 3 stars otherwise it would definitely be 4. Overall though I'm extremely happy with my membership.

showerReviews.reviewText: This year was the first time I have visited Lido since I came to Cheltenham. I am so happy I got the chance to enjoy such a good time, relaxing in the nice and fresh pool, doing a bit of swimming (I am not the best of swimmers, but I'll float). First two times we've been there wasn't so busy, the third time it got way busier because kids started the Summer holidays, so it was a little bit of wait in the queue, but no more than maybe 10 minutes. We did booked the tickets in advance always. There's a caf√© restaurant there as well where you can buy food. I've had the double cheeseburger with cheesy fries and it's a very generous portion, so make sure you have the appetite to finish it. Highly recommend it for an enjoyable family time.
showerReviews.author: Mirela Anghel

showerReviews.reviewText:
My child has been on one stage for about 9 months. They introduced a new system a while ago for updating and tracking progress but it doesn't get updated unless you speak up. When you do, they tell you that it's the system's fault. The last update done was about 2 months ago.

This is not the first or second time this has happened. I am on the waiting list of another swimming centre. Once there's an opening, I will leave them.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely small instructional pool - great for smaller kids and those learning to swim. Friendly staff and great atmosphere - no lockers etc things are stored in cubicles around the pool. Have to book by phone but will need your leisure number (get one on Bham Council site)
showerReviews.author: Steven Parkes

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely small instructional pool - great for smaller kids and those learning to swim. Friendly staff and great atmosphere - no lockers etc things are stored in cubicles around the pool. Have to book by phone but will need your leisure number (get one on Bham Council site)

showerReviews.reviewText: Great swimming instructors but incompetent manager who doesn't take his job seriously. Took our kids to their first swimming lessons then we were told the manager booked the wrong lessons. Lessons are mostly fully booked and they don't do a waiting list. Existing kids don't get the priority to be informed of when spaces become available. Spaces open up to anyone who pay in advance and they normally get filled up quite quickly. When our kids were ready to progress to next stage, we had to keep asking almost every week to check the availability of lessons. When eventually there was availability, the manager again booked the wrong stage! Parents have to re-enrol children every term and we were not fully informed when re-enrolment was due. The notice up at the front desk with the weeks for re-enrolment were no good for parents going through the back of the pool. Lack of communication from the management team caused a lot of hassles unless parents keep things on top. The pool needs refurbishment and more shower facilities.
showerReviews.author: Race Runner

showerReviews.reviewText: Our son aged 7 started swimming lessons January 22 and had zero confidence! We started late due to covid! And us being a bit laid back also! After 12 months our boy has transformed from being scared to swim without armbands to swimming confidently without any additional floats front and back! And is now learning breastroke! We are so proud and happy on how well he is progressing! Thanks to Graham and the rest of the team!

showerReviews.reviewText:
review of BIRMINGHAM BRANCH SPECIFICALLY

The facilities of the gym are very decent, a lot of kit and decent equipment.
HOWEVER, the gym is horrible, there is no etiquette, dumbbells are always left on the floor and individual parties use up to 4 sets of dumbbells, I get it but it‚Äôs a community gym, extremely selfish. I wanted to use the sauna but was disgusted, spitting on the floors, not washing before entering - vile. The toilets are equally disgusting do not look like they are cleaned at all. At some times it can be a pleasant experience but after work it‚Äôs awful. There is plenty of parking the car park however is always full, not an issue I understand it‚Äôs busy.

The gym culture however it awful. Lack of respect for others and extreme selfish individuals.

Cancelled after 5 sessions and will not be returning.

Other JD gyms I been to seem a lot better, same decent equipment and a well thought out gym. The sauna is a great add on and the operating hours are very good.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Pedrycz

showerReviews.reviewText:
Signed up, went once and cancelled membership.

Gym is over packed, free weights section is a genuine safety issue with people leaving dumbbells all over the floor. Never been to a gym before where people just throw their weights down then walk away. Had to wait for every machine I wanted to use and not even any space in the ab mat / stretching area.

Male changing rooms were disgusting, whole room is soaking wet, even 2 of the hair dryers were just left turned on with no one using them.

Avoid this gym and pay more somewhere less busy and have actually have staff on the gym floor. Even though the equipment is good (standard for a JD gym), this is the worst gym I‚Äôve ever been to in regards to safety, cleanliness and overcrowding.
showerReviews.author: Reece Suffield

For shy women or just women looking for some privacy in a workout it is great, just to top it of you don't even need to leave the changing room to get there! They made it as an extension of the room! definitely worth it üòÜ

showerReviews.reviewText: Things are always broken. Good free weights room. Some of the equipment is separated by a floor, which can be annoying. For instance, the leg extension machine is on the yop floor, but the squat racks are on the floor below. Also, there is a tendency for broken machines to become broken more often than would be good, and stay broken longer than is ideal. On the whole, however, this is good value for money. One note is that while the gym is open 24 hours a day, the changing rooms and showers are not. They open at around 5 (no idea when they close).

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited Nuffield Health Birmingham with my partner and was extremely disappointed. The centre felt dirty and disorganised from the moment we arrived. The changing rooms had visible mould, thick dust on the grooves in benches, and the poolside area was just as poor and felt unsafe for a female. There was no spa, despite it being advertised at the entrance, which felt misleading.

A staff member ‚Äî a short male with an accent and a nose ring ‚Äî behaved very unprofessionally, repeatedly trying to persuade us to book cash personal training sessions with him and even offering massage treatments to my partner, which made us both uncomfortable.

When I tried to speak to someone about everything, I was told no one was available. Parts of the facility also smelled strongly of cannabis, which is absolutely unacceptable in a health centre.

Overall, this experience was far below what I expect from Nuffield. This site is letting the brand down badly.

The location is the only thing going for it but thats about it. Needs a complete overhaul.
showerReviews.author: Jane Winter

showerReviews.reviewText:

The changing rooms had visible mould, thick dust on the grooves in benches, and the poolside area was just as poor and felt unsafe for a female. There was no spa, despite it being advertised at the entrance, which felt misleading.

Overall, this experience was far below what I expect from Nuffield. This site is letting the brand down badly.

The location is the only thing going for it but thats about it. Needs a complete overhaul.

showerReviews.reviewText: I give it 3 stars. It is a pleasant place with nice staff. When we arrived the receptionist offered for us to upgrade our massage to deep tissue and add more time for a fair price so I did that and I was happy with that. The atmosphere and decor is not luxurious but is pleasant nonetheless. I really enjoyed my massage I think the masseuse's name was January? If I heard correctly. She did a lovely massage one of the best I've had great deep pressure. I would say it should be more clear where to get food from, but that wasn't a problem for us as we brought sandwiches with us. There was a hot drink machine which was nice. I enjoyed the gym there was a great boxing area there good for releasing rage but I did have to ask about where the boxing gloves were as they were in a different room. The relaxation lounge was lovely the water beds were nice and comfy I could have had a nap!   It would have been good for the receptionist to state the different facilities at the start of the spa day so we were informed of all the areas, however it was OK because we went on a mooch around the place and found our own way around. In general it was a clean and tidy place I would say the bathroom sinks need a bit more cleaning around the rims and the changing room floors and walls need a little more attention but in general it was clean enough. It was a bit hard to find the showers after using the spa as they just look like changing rooms someone had to show us. So be aware of that. We didn't go in the pool as it wasn't warm enough but that might be influenced because we were warm from the steam room and hot tub. We enjoyed the hot tub bubbles although sometimes the bubbles took a while to come on. The steam room was very good for working as a decongestant and good for asthmatic cough and chestiness clearing the chest afterwards. Very hot in there could only do 5 minutes at a time. There was only 2 elemis testers on display which was a downfall. My friend and I were disappointed because when we opened them they were Completely empty and no sign that there was cream in them it was completely clean. We mentioned this to the receptionist who said we should have said something earlier as they are supposed to have cream in them. But didn't explain why they were empty so I am still baffled as to why they were empty. As I was very excited to do testers so I was disappointed. But other than that we did have a lovely day and a relaxing day. The highlights were the massage, the gym, the relaxation lounge room and the steam room. All in all a nice place and had a lovely day. There are more fancy spas out there that I've been to but this one was close by and affordable and pleasant. So we did have a lovely spa day.
showerReviews.author: Ruth Palmer

locations.title: Foundry Gym Kings Heath Birmingham
locations.address: ÓÉà153, kings Heath, High St, King's Heath, Birmingham B14 7DG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym was good before and improvements were made but maintenance is shocking.

The men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs bathrooms need serious improving. The men‚Äôs cubicles don‚Äôt even have basic privacy. No locks or handles on any of the doors at all.

When machines break they usually take ages to get fixed. The nautilus lat row machine took months to repairs. The seated hamstring machine has been fixed but incorrectly.

If you drop weights you get a warning which is understandable but should be fair for all. It‚Äôs not fair to pick and choose who gets a warning and who doesn‚Äôt.

Members have been asking for a water fountain for months / over a year. Still no sign. We understand it‚Äôs a business and water bottles bring in money but a water fountain is a basic need.

The owners are nice guys but it feels as though they have been concentrating more on the new Foundry gyms which have been opened/opening and less priority on the Kings Heath branch.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member here for 2+ years, moved recently

Let‚Äôs start with saying this gym has great equipment. Top notch.

Now let‚Äôs get to the bad bits

The toilets and changing rooms are disgusting, a public health hazard - I‚Äôm specifically taking about the men‚Äôs. The clientele of this gym leave them in such a state, it‚Äôs absolutely gross. Did their mother not teach them how to use a toilet?

Tripods, tripods everywhere it‚Äôs like being on a low budget movie set. Evan at 5 am in the morning. I wouldn‚Äôt mind but imagine advertising you go to the gym with poo all over the toilets. Embarrassing.

I could go on for a while with bad points, avoid this gym. To be honest avoid Birmingham in general the entire place is a dump and this gym is a testament to that fact. Glad I moved.

Well I guess it can‚Äôt be that bad as I was a member for 2+ years but I do hate change.
showerReviews.author: nicholas aldred

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm a 58 year old returning to training after a long absence. I am pleasantly surprised by how good this gym is.Yes it's choc full of young uni students but everyone is so welcoming and helpful. The staff are more than happy to assist with a smile. It's very clean and there always seems to be a cleaner on the go. The range and quality of equipment is very good and I've found good availability even at peak hours.There are no cleaning stations but nothing a personal  sweat towel won't fix.The area for stretching and mobility is very limited , a few cushioned mats near the door but it seems workable. Great value with ample free parking.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Switched to this gym from another branch as this was closer to home, but the experience hasn‚Äôt been really nice. The staff and equipment is really nice, but there are issues with the people coming in. Had my stuff stolen from the gym on 2 separate occasions, but the second time the thief took away something really insignificant luckily.
Other than that, this branch lacks a paper towel dispenser and sanitizer spray to clean the equipment before/after use. When a bit crowded, the gym feels a bit suffocating as well maybe because of ventilation issues.
Again, the staff and equipment is great, it‚Äôs the people who ruin gyms for others that made this a bad review.

locations.title: PureGym Birmingham Maypole - Upgrade Complete!
locations.address: ÓÉà1059-1061 Alcester Rd S, Birmingham B14 5TN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Over recent visits, I have noticed a consistent lack of cleanliness in the changing rooms. The floors are often dirty, the lockers appear unclean, and there is a persistent unpleasant odor that suggests they are not being properly maintained. Additionally, the shower areas do not appear to be cleaned regularly, creating a very uncomfortable and unhygienic environment for members.

Equally troubling is the condition of the bins throughout the gym. They are frequently overflowing and emitting a foul smell, which not only affects the overall atmosphere but poses potential health concerns. In some cases, waste is left around the bins instead of being disposed of properly.

As a paying member, I believe it is reasonable to expect a clean and sanitary environment, especially in areas where hygiene is most critical. I kindly urge you to take immediate action to address these issues by implementing more frequent and thorough cleaning protocols and ensuring staff are trained to maintain basic cleanliness standards.
showerReviews.author: Mo Ab

Toilets and changing rooms are normally clean however a few times there has been no toilet roll and mess near the sink. I haven‚Äôt joined a class yet at this gym only other pure gyms so I can‚Äôt really comment on this. But it would be good if Zumba/legs bums & tums were available in the afternoons instead of just the evenings. Also the pin entry on the ground floor can be quite frustrating sometimes when the doors aren‚Äôt opening properly, this has happened many times with and without myself carrying bags. Overall even though this gym is far from my house and my work, this gym is great & worth traveling to!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been training here for the past more then  12 months, and this place is a game-changer. The equipment is top-notch ‚Äî everything from free weights and squat racks to a wide range of machines is well-maintained and always available. The gym floor is spacious, clean, and never feels overcrowded, even during peak hours.

The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and always ready to help with form correction or workout tips. The trainers genuinely care about your progress and offer great advice tailored to your goals.

The atmosphere is motivating ‚Äî you can tell everyone here is serious about their fitness but still respectful and encouraging to each other. The playlist is upbeat, the air conditioning is perfect, and the locker rooms are spotless with good showers.

Whether you‚Äôre lifting heavy, doing cardio, or just starting your fitness journey, this gym has everything you need. Easily the best investment I‚Äôve made for my health this year!

It's getting harder and harder to train in this gym, from 24h to 6 - 23 at the same price.
Changing room are always in bad conditions, machines always faulty and air-conditioning is disgusting. Most of the time it is put on hot air or turned off, as well as full of dust in the vents making it difficult to breathe when training.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Used to come here loads some years back - first time visiting in a while though. Shocked at the state of the place, even compared to my usual 'The Gym' elsewhere.

The entrance passage, hallways, lifts are all really tatty, with broken buttons in the lift. Doesn't feel safe. Into the locker room - lots of broken / damaged lockers.

On the gym floor - several broken machines. The rest have seen better days - many don't move smoothly, or one side moves more freely than the other giving you a lop-sided workout?

The gym floor is dark and dingy, I actually witnessed someone using their phone torch to see the markings on the weight stacks at one point!

Showers were visibly dirty especially some of the grouting. The changing rooms were inexplicably really hot - so I was sweating again getting dressed... so taking a shower was a bit of a waste of time!
showerReviews.author: Dan

locations.title: Welcome Break Hopwood Park Services M42
locations.address: ÓÉàJct 2, M42, Redditch Rd, Alvechurch, Birmingham B48 7AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: A nice convenient pit-stop while travelling, with a large car park for the coaches. The place is very bright and colourful. The üöª toilets are on your right as you enter. The ladies is very large with lots of cubicles. Its quite clean, though I don't think you can keep it spotless when used by dozens of women and hour. Theres various eating cafes to choose from with numerous drinks, either from the cafe or a machine. The turnaround is quite quick so you're in and out if the coach is leaving after you've been to the loo. Or there's seated tables to eat a full meal as well as benches along the wall for resting. Its also a gift shop, so be prepared to be assaulted by merchandise as soon as you go in. But its quite expensive too, I'd save your money for the trip you're on. Staff are efficient, though young and bored looking. Theres dozens of these stops along the motorway and all identical to the girl chewing gum.
showerReviews.author: Linda Cross

showerReviews.reviewText: Where do you start! The food is normally very good! Most of the staff are very friendly with a smile, thank you Chrissy! The parking guy's are exceptionally friendly and good in the aspect of when you are leaving! üëåüëè. During the warmer weather this place is swarming with flies im sorry I don't want to be throwing my hands around like a sign language person for the deaf while I'm eating.  As for the facilities showers & toilets my god they could do with bleach or acid soaking in them for a month. Out of hour toilets wow, one toilet doest & hasn't had a seat on it for 12 months which is disgusting & two months ago the other & only two out of hours toilets the door was on the floor. Lincoln farm, yes you are always busy but please show some respect to your faithful customers & put some money back in for the sake of your customers. I know drivers who say the place is disgusting & like a hovel and won't return. Sorry for the truth but it's reality.

showerReviews.reviewText: Having read some other reviews, I guess I just expect too much! It was like going back to what I imagine trucking was like in the 1970's. Deep fried poor quality sausage! Not seen since Glasgow 1994. Parking was ok, large yard, well organised if you don't get boxed in, the toilets and shower were like Cub Camp 1978. If you have a less than clean toilet area at least invest 30p in each cubicle so there is a hook to keep stuff off the floor - 2 stars. Restaurant - 0 stars. When you have a lorry park, rammed for the evening @ ¬£24 each, surely a quality breakfast is a possibility - filter coffee or espresso? Just because there is a lot on the plate doesn't make it good. Very few in for breakfast, it would be busier if the breakfast was better.  I sometimes wish that the owners of these places would take a trip to mainland Europe to see what a truckers restaurant is supposed to be like in this day and age. I try to support smaller establishments rather than give money to Moto etc but please help make our job a little more comfortable when away from family home for the week!  Thanks
showerReviews.author: P Barnes

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely amazing place. Yes it's get full fast, yes it's on a slope  in some places..... but.... food is absolutely winner 10/10

Top price (as you have a few options) is ¬£35 with ¬£12 food voucher. Other options  are for ¬£6/¬£31  and so on. ¬£ 12  feed you everything  from menu apart from fully monty grill  ¬£15.95
Food menu is massive,including  burgers,curry,kebabs,home made pizza sandwiches  and so on. Food is awesome!  Trucker next to me said they try to kill you with the size of those portions. I saw different  platters out and all was great and when ask all said amazing. So a big shout out to a kitchen staff!

All place  very clean and tidy, don't forget to take token for a shower(7min plenty enough)  shower  room with massive space and regulated temperature of water üòéüí¶üòç so in summer - winner.

Staff mostly  very friendly  and kind, one bad egg but it might  be not his day so I won't  blame or judge  his life  on that. We all had it.

If by any  chance  I will be around, even  for a sneaky 45 I will be there!

I would recommend it 100%

The mushrooms chicken was not cooked enough, I didn‚Äôt send it back because it was impossible to do anything about it after that and I didn‚Äôt want to find some ‚Äòspices‚Äô added. They couldn‚Äôt provide me the bank card receipt which I needed. And the showers are good, but they should have start/stop buton, especially for women, 7-8 minutes it is not enough, or at least it should play the sound one minute before ending, not when the water stops so we are able to rinse.

locations.title: Onroute Truckstops - Junction 29
locations.address: ÓÉàholmewood industrial estate, Holmewood, Chesterfield S42 5SA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Really Good food, good showers , truck shop ,new exit around back !! Fuel available . Busy because its decent, easy access üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText:
First time visit to Onroute Truckstop Jcn 29 of the M1. First of all a congratulations to all the staff on site, I engaged with ground staff who were at the fuel pumps, shop staff, the catering team in the restaurant and visited the truck wash.

On arrival, my purpose of the visit was to refuel, quick shower, some breakfast and wash my truck. All of which were the result of my eroute @SNAP app. Fuel pumps were easily accessible with over head canopy at 5m height restriction.

Keyfuels, UK fuels and Silvey Fuel cards accepted with loads of information boards encouraging you to sign up to the Onroute app and collect loyalty points which can be reclaimed onsite as discounts towards purchases, and 50% off your first restaurant order. A few minutes later my app was installed and breakfast ordered whilst stood at the fuel pumps!

Parked up and next on the agenda was a quick shower. Straight into the shower block which was spotlessly clean on entry with a separate changing and drying area. A bit old school but better than trying to dress on a wet floor. Striped off and wondered into the shower cubicle to find a vending machine at the shower with a notice to buy a token from the shop at ¬£2.50 for the pleasure. I was sorely tempted to walk back out naked to get my token but decided as time was of the essence and my breakfast was being cooked, to dismiss the shower for now. Perhaps moving the notice to the shower door would be advised? As a result no review to the showers or the hot water, but looking at the shower curtains, stained and tired looking, we‚Äôll leave that there.

The shop staff, stock available and friendly engagement was first class. I picked up some Tacho rolls and paid via Apple Pay at the till and was given a receipt without asking. Conversations were flowing and a happy environment - 10/10.

In the foyer and just outside the front door with the usual slot machines and laundry facilities, all working and available for use.  Plenty more information on hand about facilities on offer and selection of advertising.

Into the restaurant and again a joyful atmosphere with happy staff and a greeting by another member of staff ensuring I had downloaded the Onroute app and even offered me a fuel card application for silvey - nice touch. Food was presented bang on time as per the app order, was piping hot and further enquiries if I needed anything else, which I didn‚Äôt. They catered for everything. Very well done 10/10.

After breakfast I retired with my coffee to the seating area outside for my cigarette and the smoking area was fully accessible, clean and tidy.

Finally the truck wash, which was the purpose of the visit. I departed Driffield in Yorkshire on route to the South West and my collected trailer was black. It was supposed to be white!  Logging into the Snap app my first available truck wash on route was here. So this was a fairly integral part of my visit. You can imagine my disappointment to pull up and find it abandoned and closed. 0/10

All in all, not a bad experience, not sure if the truck wash is permanently closed but it‚Äôs let the site down in its overall scores.
showerReviews.author: Casper Roe-Lavery

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at Digbeth Backpackers and I have to say, it was an incredible experience. From the moment I walked in, I was impressed by the modern, clean aesthetic of the entrance. The decor was stylish and inviting, and everything felt fresh and well-maintained.

The bed was super comfortable, with soft, high-quality linens that made for a perfect night‚Äôs sleep. I also appreciated the thoughtful amenities, including  Costa Coffee and high-speed Wi-Fi that made it easy to relax or get some work done. The bathroom was spacious, with plush towels and a rain shower that felt like a luxurious spa experience.

The hotel‚Äôs location was ideal‚Äîconvenient to restaurants, shops, and attractions, yet tucked away enough to provide a peaceful retreat. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, always ensuring that my stay was enjoyable.

Overall, this hotel room was definitely worth the price. It provided comfort, convenience, and excellent service‚Äîeverything you could ask for in a great stay. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway or a business trip with a touch of luxury!

Overall, this hotel room was definitely worth the price. It provided comfort, convenience, and excellent service‚Äîeverything you could ask for in a great stay. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway or a business trip with a touch of luxury!

The mattress however was absolutely awesome along with the pillow selection tion.

locations.title: Kingsbury Waterpark Camping and Caravanning Club
locations.address: ÓÉàBodymoor Heath Ln, Sutton Coldfield B76 0DY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
A lovely site in a great location by the water park and also the canal giving lots of choice for walks and cycling.
The site is well laid out, pitches feel set well apart and are all well maintained.
The site has two toilet/shower blocks and both were spotless. The large block by reception has a laundry room with one washing machine and tumble dryer.
I was pitched in the oval, backing onto visitor parking which was quite noisy at times with guests having their music playing loudly in their cars and/or parking up and leaving the engine running. Not the fault of the wardens or site but maybe a couple of signs at the visitor parking reminding people to keep noise to a minimum.
Depending on which way the wind is blowing there is some background noise from the motorway but I didn‚Äôt find it an issue.
I will definitely stay again.

locations.title: The Paddock Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉà34 Gould Firm Ln, Walsall WS9 0LX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positives - reasonably priced, hosts very welcoming, easy to find and a 5 minute walk to bus routes into Bridlington and Scarborough. Quiet after 11pm. Fire pit and wood available. Farm shop next door. Pub 5 minutes walk. Electric hookup available. Dog friendly.

Negatives - overcrowded. Tents are literally on top of each other, each others tent strings where overlapping if they where that close. No ball games allowed (there wasn't enough room anyway given the tents where that cramped in) There was at least 10-15 minuets wait for a toilet between 7am-11pm as the toilets are wet rooms (x3) so family's where showering taking over the whole toilet block. The showers where filthy, probably due to the amount of people on site but we where walking through dirty wet toilet roll on the floor and puddles of muddy water when we where getting out of the shower. It's probably a good idea to have the toilets separate and consider having fewer people.
showerReviews.author: michelle johnson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely site we had 5 nights here it is so peaceful.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just returned from an excellent 5 night stay. Lovely site set in woodland, the facilities are exceptionally clean and modern with proper showers rather than push button showers, I didn't have to wait to use the shower and toilet facilities once, which considering the site was very well occupied was brilliant.
We saw the members of staff around all day cleaning and tidying as they went, even outside of the shower and toilet facilities cleaning times they were in there mopping the floor and doing the things other guests didn‚Äôt do to keep it nice and clean. All 3 members of staff we saw and spoke to were very polite, very helpful and well presented in their uniform.
The metered electric worked very well, the link you get sent via text message shows exactly how much you have left and it also sends a message when you're running low, topping up was very simple. I saw some people complaining about metered electric on Facebook, however I think it is the only way to stop people from taking advantage of non metered electric and running high draw devices all day and night, ultimately they are a business so why should they pay for your air-conditioning and awning heaters, this could easily cost more than the entire site fee for one night. They give you ¬£2 a day which is very fair, and I'm sure most people will find that sufficient. We used a little bit more than that as we had the heating on a lot, until we get the refund from our unused credit I don't know exactly what it cost, but probably no more than ¬£10 extra for the 5 nights.
Access to the site is very easy with no narrow lanes to navigate down, and a simple to use keypad to operate the electric gate for entry and exit.
There were a few occasions the airport noise got annoying if the wind was blowing the wrong way, but hey, you can't expect to stay 8 miles from an airport and not hear planes some of the time! This doesn't detract from what is an absolutely beautiful site and as mentioned has the best facilities we have found on a site.
showerReviews.author: Martyn Winspear

showerReviews.reviewText:

There are hardstanding & grass pitches, many with EHU, but I chose no EHU, which was ¬£25 per night. Toilets & basins are well catered for, but there are only 2 large shower units onsite. Showers are free and there is plenty of hot water. There is a pub, The Case is Altered, just 20 minutes walk up the road, which doesn‚Äôt offer food. The site could probably do with a bit of a spruce up, but it was clean, so I would recommend it.

locations.title: Silver Trees Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàStafford Brook Rd, Rugeley WS15 2TX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Another fantastic stay at Silver Trees.
Greated by the friendly owners we are always made to feel extremely welcome. This is the perfect holiday if you want to feel the benefits of being surrounded by nature and taking things easy. Our children are always happiest when allowed freedom to explore in the great outdoors and Cannock Chase is situated just across the road from Silver trees making it the perfect base to explore.
The park is immaculate and since our last visit the site has undergone improvements including the newly renovated swimming pool which features Bluetooth speakers so you can listen to your favourite music while you have a swim, the pool area and the water is always nice and warm.
All of the caravans have fantastic views over the nature reserve where you can sit and watch the deer. Our children also like feeding them with the deer food available to buy from reception. This was our second time staying at Silver trees and we have stayed in both Blackberry and Elderberry caravans which are both great however we have already booked to return next year and are looking forward to staying in new accommodation called Buck view lodge. This lodge is brand new and will offer incredible views from it's own private decking right up towards the ridge of the nature reserve where we will be able to watch the stags rutting. I can't think of anywhere else this unique and beautiful.
Thank you all again for another amazing break and we can't wait to see you again next year if not before.
Kind regards
Akers family
showerReviews.author: Matt Akers

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just had another fantastic stay at Silver tree's, this is our second year staying here and it was just as lovely as the first. We holidayed as a family of four, myself, my husband and our two sons aged 7 and 3. My boys are fascinated by the deer and loved being able to get close and even feed them at times. The site is clean and well cared for, the caravans we have stayed in are spotless, the first year we stayed in Blackberry which has incredible views over the ridge, we stayed during rutting season and it's fascinating to watch the stags. This year we stayed in Elderberry which is a beautiful caravan with equally great views.
We have also just booked to come again next year and we are going to be in the brand new Buck lodge, an addition to the current lodges already there with front and side decking to enjoy the views and watch the deer.
The staff are fantastic, really friendly and helpful and we enjoyed chatting to them when we popped into reception everyday!
The facilities on site are great, a fantastic swimming pool which you book for your family's own private hire for the hour, it's very clean and lovely and warm. We also enjoyed the tennis court this year, rackets and balls are provided free of charge which was fab!
The site is a short walk from Cannock chase and the woodland walks are just wonderful.
Silver trees is a real gem, and we just love coming here.
showerReviews.author: Jess Akers

locations.title: Kingfisher Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàP6F4+95, Burton upon Trent, Burton-on-Trent DE13 7DN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely a beautiful place to stay. Right on the canal. Kingfisher Park has a heated swimming pool booked by hourly sessions just for you and your family. Crown green bowls green, table tennis, games room, play park and above all very modern mobile homes with everything you need and spotlessly clean. Cafe on site has a great menu with very reasonable prices. Fishing is available on site. Plenty of walks around the lake and the canal is a busy area where barges are docking to have a drink in the quaint pub where we enjoyed a meal on Friday evening and were entertained by live music. 8 band members playing Irish music with fiddles and accordions and instruments not known to me. Wonderful. Put this place on your wish list to visit. You will not be disappointed.
showerReviews.author: Lorraine McGill

showerReviews.reviewText:
My 3-year-old daughter was supposed to start her swimming lessons today, and we followed all the instructions provided in the email. We arrived on time, were directed to the pool, and waited for the lessons to begin.

When the instructor arrived, I informed her that it was my daughter's first day and that she had never been in a pool before. While we waited for the safety belt, the instructor focused on other children who were not beginners, leaving my daughter unattended. When I inquired about what we should be doing, a lifeguard instructed my daughter to sit at the end of the pool while I returned to the deck.

Suddenly, the lifeguard asked my daughter to jump into the pool‚Äîdespite her never having been in the water before. She nearly drowned for 30 seconds while the lifeguard stood by and watched. i was shocked by the lack of care and negligence.

When I questioned the instructor afterwards, she seemed completely unaware of the proper protocols for handling a child on her first day. What happened today was an alarming example of endangering a child's safety due to careless supervision.

As a result of this incident, my daughter is now frightened and refuses to ever enter a pool again
showerReviews.author: Shwetha Gowda

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been using Centre AT7 for over 8 years, and I can honestly say this is the worst it has ever been. The management is a joke ‚Äî constantly making excuses, blaming ‚Äúparts from Germany‚Äù that somehow take months to arrive, while members keep paying for broken facilities.

Hygiene is terrible. On my last visit, they claimed the spa was closed for a ‚Äúdeep clean,‚Äù yet there was hair all over the steam room floor. I sat in there for 45 minutes and not a single staff member checked the area ‚Äî a complete failure of health and safety.

On a Bank Holiday (when the pool and spa have always been open in the past), everything was shut. When I asked why, the staff couldn‚Äôt give a straight answer. It just comes across as lazy and careless.

Centre AT7 used to be a great place, but the current management clearly don‚Äôt care about the members. They‚Äôre happy to take your money but won‚Äôt deliver even the basics ‚Äî working facilities, proper cleaning, or decent customer service.

Unless things improve drastically, I won‚Äôt be recommending this place to anyone.

The changing rooms were the only downside. As spacious as they are, the cleanliness was horrific. It smelt like wee the second you open the door to the changing rooms and it was like that all throughout, (men‚Äôs, women‚Äôs & mixed - husband came as well). The staff were lovely, guests also very friendly. The splash pool was nicely designed, however for an infant pool ran a little on the colder side, maybe if the pool was put to a temperature suitable for 2months+?? (Just a suggestion)
The changing rooms were the only downside. As spacious as they are, the cleanliness was horrific. It smelt like wee the second you open the door to the changing rooms and it was like that all throughout, (men‚Äôs, women‚Äôs & mixed - husband came as well). It definitely wasn‚Äôt the kind of thing I‚Äôd expect from a pool facility nor a gym since people of all ages & sensitivities are exposed to such dirt.
Would love to see it cleaned more often so that I‚Äôd feel comfortable to bring family along.
showerReviews.author: YPKs Kitchen

showerReviews.reviewText:
I visited the leisure centre for the first time to go swimming and was extremely disappointed by the experience. Upon arrival, I was greeted by staff members behaving unprofessionally behind the reception desk, with food and drinks scattered across the counter.
The changing rooms were in a shocking state ‚Äî there was a strong smell of urine, human waste in the corner of one cubicle, a used sanitary towel on the floor, and food wrappers left behind. It was clear the area had not been cleaned for some time.
In the pool, only three-quarters of the space was available due to lessons taking place, yet I was still charged the full admission price. Partway through the session, the fire alarm sounded and everyone was told to evacuate the pool, only to be told moments later that it was a false alarm and to return.
The most concerning issue was discovering a razor left on the poolside, which posed a serious safety risk. Alarmingly, no staff member appeared to respond appropriately to this situation.
Overall, the entire visit raised major concerns about hygiene, safety, and professionalism.
showerReviews.author: Daniel Foster

Hey everyone! I've been going to the Allan Higgs Centre in Coventry for the past three months, and I'm thrilled to share my 5-star experience with you!

The facilities are top-notch, with an Olympic-sized swimming pool, sports courts, a fully-equipped gym, and more. Everything is well-maintained and clean, allowing me to focus on my fitness goals.

The staff is amazing, always ready to help with a smile. They've been an integral part of my fitness journey.

locations.title: Caludon Castle Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàAxholme Rd, Coventry CV2 5BD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Negatives
My daughter was in stage 2 and was not quite getting her technique right. She essentially was asked to swim up and down continuously with verbal commands on how to get her arms and position her feet and back etc. Having just turned 4, you expect to have someone actually show and teach her how to swim. This was not the case despite being advertised as such on the page.
I asked someone get into the water with her to show her the technique. The person was very kind and obliging and said that they would next week.
Since then however, there has been a different person every week. I have raised the same issue over and over with the same promise that it will be different next week and an assurance it will be the same person but it isn't.
This has been the case for 6 weeks straight.

We have decided to go somewhere else because they don't listen and respond to feedback, there is no consistency, there is no discussion on how a child is doing and how they are progressing as it passes on from one teacher to another, there is no support with technique just verbal commands in a very loud and busy room, no differentiation to support different learners - just a one size fits all approach.

The showers are also cold. I was told they were having issues but again this has been going on for 6 weeks.

The app has a progress review section. Never has it been filled in.

Positives
The staff are friendly and kind
Other groups have people get in the water and show them how to do it
The level 1 man is in every week supporting the children
showerReviews.author: Leigh-Anne Wharton

showerReviews.reviewText: Great range of gym equipment and classes but has its problems. Gym etiquette isn't the best, equipment is left around on the floor and people rarely wipe machines down. Air conditioning in studios 3 & 4 either keeps breaking or just isn't adjusted for classes (way too hot for body pump, too cold for yoga & pilates). Showers are a bit grim, really bad smell and drain flies. Steam room is slimy and people don't wear flip flops or anything, just barefoot. Overall good facilities and staff are lovely, but it's a bit gross.

Majority of machines will have piles of weights on them. Common for squat racks to be left with weights on.

Ultimately world class facilities let down by a number of factors.

- Poor basic gym ettiequte from members (leaving weights on machines)
- Appear to be external (non Warwick uni) fitness groups taking up large areas of the gym for hours at a time with little consideration for others. Staff not bothered.
- Completely unable to book tennis courts etc. As you are unable to buy a ‚Äògym only‚Äô membership it‚Äôs then annoying to not be able to use most of the other sport facilities.
- Slow to repair broken facilities. Steam room broken for months. Facilities in men‚Äôs changing rooms broken for months and shower drains unclean.

Gym itself is excellent with a large number of squat racks.

locations.title: Spindles Health & Leisure Club
locations.address: ÓÉàTamworth Rd, Coventry CV7 8JG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only good thing about this gym is the staff who work there who i cannot fault in anyway and they are brilliant and i mean brilliant. There is a great bunch of regular people who use the club who are very down to earth.

Now, where to start...

Head office really need to revamp the facilities from top to bottom. In need of some serious investment and judging by the previous comments many years ago seems things have not changed till date which is disappointing . Jacuzzi has not been working for months which is a eyesore every time you enter the pool area with still no confirmed date for repair. Steam room seems to always need repair once a month (not working again now and not sure when this will be working again, been more than a week already). Maybe this is a business move from head office with energy costs going up? Could really do with more seating area in the pool area, with only 1 table and 3/4 chairs would be nice to have more dotted around.

Gym area again is very outdated. Some of the pads on the machines are damaged which have not been replaced. This does cause a few grazes and discomfort when lifting weights and obviously you cannot sanitize the area properly. Windows seem like they have not been cleaned in years and it would be lovely to have a TV playing like typical gyms but unfortunately this is a no go. Funnily enough there is a sign by the water machine saying that we are moving away from using plastic cups to be more environmentally friendly. Surprisingly there has always been plastic cups there when i have looked when requiring hydration !! Health and safety wise the fire exit door has rope/ plastic bollards in the way to prevent people entering leaving this way when the door is left open when its hot. Pretty sure fire exits meant to be kept clear from all obstacles?

For those attending don't forget to bring a padlock for the outdated lockers (a lot of lockers are broken) rather than a pound like typical leisure clubs. Hygiene wise there is ample mould in the men's shower areas which personally i find disgusting and surprised this has not been addressed.

Spindles after years and years of neglect its about time you invested in your facilities. Someone from higher management needs to come and see for themselves what its like here and make changes. Great bunch of people working here but you can obviously see there disappointment and tired faces every time people ask when will this be repaired. Spindles, help out you staff and please make this place better.
showerReviews.author: Sunny Singh

locations.title: The Wave Waterpark
locations.address: ÓÉàNew Union St, Coventry CV1 2PS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
We decided to take a trip to Coventry on Sunday and experience The Wave which is a fully enclosed waterpark.
Having pre-booked the check was very simple.
We were all given wristbands which after a bit of fiddling managed to open the lockers in the changing village.
You first walking past The Reef which is themed for smaller children and has slides, tipping bucket and water jets.
Then you have a choice of the wave pool which is the largest in the UK or the smooth flowing lazy river.
The other option is choosing one of the 6 flumes on offer with three of them riding on inflatables.
Unfortunately on the the day we visited The Torrent was not available!
The Wave is well staffed and all are polite and helpful.
We parked in the Salt Lane carpark where if you enter you car reg in The Wave on a wall tablet you will receive a discount.
showerReviews.author: Villan Chris
