showerReviews.reviewText: The waterpark has the right idea but hasn‚Äôt quite got it right. Went off peak 4.30pm session on a Friday. Park was really quiet hardly any queues (less than 4 people infront of you for every slide!) which was really good! The baby park downstairs is in completely the wrong place, it‚Äôs feezing cold for any young ones or babies due to the draft coming through the changing rooms. Our baby was shivering when we went down there, so we couldn‚Äôt stay. The water also isn‚Äôt the warmest, and the air is also quite cold when you‚Äôre not in the water. The slides looked really good, the lazy river is a little bit small & the wave pool is tiny. The circle shape of the building is good but really annoying when you‚Äôve done a few laps of the building to get to slides. They could do with some rubber matting because it‚Äôs really slippery even when walking round. Staff are all quite young, but very friendly and looked to be on the ball with safety. Overall it wasn‚Äôt too bad, more suitable for kids 10-16 than any other age. & wish it was a bit warmer!
showerReviews.author: Danni Jurek

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited here in August and unfortunately suffered an accident and fractured my foot. The experience from the life guards wasn't the best, they didn't really know how to deal with it. One guy I dealt with was brilliant but unfortunately the girl he was with didn't seem to want to help, when asked to find my husband, she wasn't very interested and when she did my husband asked her what had happened and she ignored him. I had to sign a waiver to say they weren't at fault then I was left in the changing rooms. The lovely receptionist checked on me as we left and offered us a free visit, I replied to this email regarding my experience but never received a response.
showerReviews.author: Amy Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText: Good potential, but as lots of others have said, far too many people to really enjoy it. We did three slides before deciding the queues were too big to bother. My 6 year old was looking forward to this for weeks but was really disappointed. They should limit the amount of people in the park if everyone that attends feels like it‚Äôs too busy. Also, the organisation at the start was terrible. Booked for a session to start at 4pm. It was 4.30 by the time we actually got into the pool area. Changing facilities were clean but so many broken lockers and cubicle doors. Won‚Äôt be returning.
showerReviews.author: Rich Sharpe

showerReviews.reviewText: Looks amazing inside, lots of slides and loads to do for the family. There doesn't seem to be any parking however, at the time of our visit there was a few cars parked outside the doors sneaked through barriers (which doesn't seem to be designated spaces) and others parked around the outside on pavements and double yellows which I was also forced to do. Also unfortunately there isn't a viewing gallery to watch the kids as they swim. They do have a waiting/cafe area as you walk in but the swimming pool is not visible at all unless you are swimming. so bear that in mind if you are hoping to let the kids swim while you watch.
showerReviews.author: A J

showerReviews.reviewText: Looks amazing inside, lots of slides and loads to do for the family. showerReviews.author: A J

showerReviews.reviewText:
The kids (10 & 13) had been plaguing me to take them here for ages so I finally relented and, to be fair, I was quite excited to go too.

The initial impression was decent. We got let in after the lady checked the confirmation email rather than using the QR code. The wristbands worked fine with the lockers and the changing rooms were nice and clean. We were then held at a rope for about 10 minutes before being let in.

There were 5 slides active with one out of action long-term at the moment, very disappointing. It quickly became obvious how much queuing we were going to be doing. In the 2 hours we were there I think we got 6 rides which is ridiculous. The lazy river and wave pool were OK but nothing you can't go to at many other pools.

The staff at the slides were pretty miserable and more interested in chatting and having a laugh with each other. I tried to joke with some of them, get a smile at least, but none seemed interested. I get it, the job is pretty tedious, holding people until the green light and, in the case of the inflatable slides, pushing people off, but still!

Oh and I slipped down the stairs getting off one of the rides, which has bruised my back and feet! I never understand pools having such slippery walking surfaces

Overall, the kids generally enjoyed it but they've said they're not bothered about going again. 2 hours sounded like a lot of time but it was FAR too busy, FAR too many people. 6 rides in 2 hours was ridiculous, especially for paying just over ¬£50 for the three of us (13 year old is considered an adult, ridiculous!!). I wouldn't recommend it to anyone as I felt it's overpriced for what it is. Oh and then we wanted a drink and something to eat coming out but the cafe looked empty of food and staff so we went over the road to a mini supermarket instead
showerReviews.author: Simon Bunyard

showerReviews.reviewText:
The kids (10 & 13) had been plaguing me to take them here for ages so I finally relented and, to be fair, I was quite excited to go too.

The initial impression was decent. We got let in after the lady checked the confirmation email rather than using the QR code. The wristbands worked fine with the lockers and the changing rooms were nice and clean. We were then held at a rope for about 10 minutes before being let in.

There were 5 slides active with one out of action long-term at the moment, very disappointing. It quickly became obvious how much queuing we were going to be doing. In the 2 hours we were there I think we got 6 rides which is ridiculous. The lazy river and wave pool were OK but nothing you can't go to at many other pools.

The staff at the slides were pretty miserable and more interested in chatting and having a laugh with each other. I tried to joke with some of them, get a smile at least, but none seemed interested. I get it, the job is pretty tedious, holding people until the green light and, in the case of the inflatable slides, pushing people off, but still!

Oh and I slipped down the stairs getting off one of the rides, which has bruised my back and feet! I never understand pools having such slippery walking surfaces

Overall, the kids generally enjoyed it but they've said they're not bothered about going again. 2 hours sounded like a lot of time but it was FAR too busy, FAR too many people. 6 rides in 2 hours was ridiculous, especially for paying just over ¬£50 for the three of us (13 year old is considered an adult, ridiculous!!). I wouldn't recommend it to anyone as I felt it's overpriced for what it is. Oh and then we wanted a drink and something to eat coming out but the cafe looked empty of food and staff so we went over the road to a mini supermarket instead
showerReviews.author: Simon Bunyard

locations.title: JD Gyms Coventry
locations.address: ÓÉàBelgrade Plaza, Upper Well St, Coventry CV1 4AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I usually like JD Gyms, but this branch is really disappointing. There‚Äôs a clear lack of gym etiquette among many users. People regularly leave weights lying around instead of putting them back‚Äîexpecting someone new or less strong to unload multiple 25‚ÄØkg plates from a barbell or leg press is unreasonable.

Dumbbells are often left scattered on the floor near benches, creating obvious trip hazards. If someone were to fall or injure themselves because of this, it could easily lead to legal action. Safety should be taken seriously. If someone is strong enough to lift the weights to use them, there‚Äôs no excuse for not racking them properly afterward.

I also can‚Äôt stand how some people have no respect for personal space or hygiene‚Äîincluding groups of students and Uber drivers who seem more interested in staring at women than actually training.

I understand people need to rest between sets, but it‚Äôs frustrating when they take 10 minutes just staring at their phones or having long conversations, with no regard for others waiting to use the machine.

On top of that, some of the equipment is badly in need of maintenance or replacement. For example, one of the calf raise machines feels like the bearings are shot, and the loading pole on the leg press is so angled it looks like the plates could fall off at any moment.

Overall, the entire branch feels neglected and seems to be relying solely on the JD Gyms name to keep attracting members. With so little competition in the area, it feels like there‚Äôs no incentive for management to address these issues.
showerReviews.author: Latif Ad Din

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's a shame with how lovely the staff is, but the quality overall seems lacking.

Some improvements since the last review, but it seems like they forgot to put any money into actually improving/fixing machines.

I don't know if the owner willingly ignores the quality issues with machines, or for some other reason pays no attention and just doesn't allocate money or resources.

The bench press assistance arms are still broken on some, the benches themselves move more than they should and are not stable.

Both of these wouldn't really be issues at low weights, but when you you're nearing and going past 100, stability starts to become a bit more important.

I suppose they're just waiting for someone to injure themselves so they can go "whoops", knowing nobody will challenge them on it.

Leg press backrest is loose. Foam on the quad extension roller is almost fully worn. Few quid to fix it? Nah, not with how busy they are. It's so bad you either need to be willing to hurt yourself on it at higher weights, or use shin pads.

I'm sure there's more issues around, just haven't bothered to look so closely.

Rules are hit and miss. Go topless in the middle of the gym while crowded? Sure. Not frequent but still happens.

No real enforcement if at all with putting weights back, or on clothing. No bike signs downstairs are more suggestions.

Even the small puregym near the Transport Museum had it in it's budget to place a cleaning station or two with paper towels around, but this was too much for JD with its higher prices and much larger footfall. Got to clean up the sweat and grime of everyone and their mother with your own things.
showerReviews.author: Codrin Gherman

Nice gym, plenty of cardio equipment. The free weights area is now better after the refurbishment.
I try to avoid the times between 4PM-8PM as that's most busy and you may struggle to find a bench, barbell, dumbell or plates. Also some members just hog the equipment when it can be shared between sets.
Plenty of lockers available but just 2 urinals and 2 toilets.
I suggest management should invest in more frequent cleaning and maybe some sort of air freshener equipment around the locker room and the main entrance.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member now for 18 months. When I joined I had no complaints at all but it's gone downhill mainly in the past 6 months.
Recently I've noticed that the lockers in the gents that actually close and lock are few and far between making finding one that I can use difficult.
Classes that were once accessible are now fully booked so fast that I am unable to actually book onto them unless I am booking at midnight the moment they go live on the app, more classes would be appreciated.
I have also felt an increasing level of disrespect from other gym users (which I appreciate isn't something the gym staff can fully control). On my last visit the treadmills were all I use aside from two which a couple of gym users had piled all of their belongings on so as to reserve them for intermittent use, the class I attended was packed full but allowed one participant to sit on the floor in the centre of the space on their phone and not a ticket joining in with the session however taking up a space regardless and then a young male in the changing room on a video call pointing his camera towards the mirror and in view of my reflection while I was drying off from using the shower and fully exposed.
I am now considering looking I to an alternative gym now as I don't see any signs of things improving here and the rapid staff turnover signals a red flag.
showerReviews.author: Edward Warwick

showerReviews.reviewText: It's an okay gym. It's annoyingly busy at 6am and even 10pm but it's not so much the amount of people that's the issue (I'm one of them!); it's that there's not enough of each type of machine to serve 70+ people. Gym goers want to get in, do their workout and go home/to work, so I end up skipping machines I wanted to use or working out another muscle group I hadn't planned to. Even treadmills are all taken up sometimes so getting a warmup in using them isn't a guarantee at busy times. If a group are working out together then you can basically kiss goodbye to being able to use whatever machines they're taking up. It's a shame and eventually I may have to switch gyms. Also the showers are weird with frosted glass and huge gaps under the doors. Not great for those who value privacy.
showerReviews.author: Jon

showerReviews.reviewText: It's an okay gym. It's annoyingly busy at 6am and even 10pm but it's not so much the amount of people that's the issue (I'm one of them!); it's that there's not enough of each type of machine to serve 70+ people. Gym goers want to get in, do their workout and go home/to work, so I end up skipping machines I wanted to use or working out another muscle group I hadn't planned to. Even treadmills are all taken up sometimes so getting a warmup in using them isn't a guarantee at busy times. If a group are working out together then you can basically kiss goodbye to being able to use whatever machines they're taking up. It's a shame and eventually I may have to switch gyms. Also the showers are weird with frosted glass and huge gaps under the doors. Not great for those who value privacy.
showerReviews.author: Jon

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great facility. Can be busy at peak times but outside that plenty of equipment free to use.
Good selection of equipment to choose from. From cardio machines to resistance to weights. Pretty clean and tidy. Always seems to be somebody about to help.
Men's changing room leaves a little to be desired, but hey, it's men and it's a gym. What do you expect? üëäüí™

locations.title: PureGym Coventry Skydome - Women's Workout Space Just Landed!
locations.address: ÓÉàSkydome, 3 Croft Rd, Coventry CV1 3AZ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely rubbish. Since the other PureGym in Coventry closed, this one is more overcrowded than ever. Finding a free machine or even a spot for a mat means waiting around. Neither the flavoured nor the regular water fountain works, there aren‚Äôt nearly enough paper towels or cleaning stations, and there aren‚Äôt enough plates. On top of that, the women‚Äôs workout space they advertise is closed. The place itself is filthy ‚Äî rubbish left on the floors, sweat on the seats, and the whole gym stinks. Unless you plan to work out at 3am, don‚Äôt bother.

EDIT: Increasing the rating to 2 starts, as the women‚Äôs only section just opened and it‚Äôs actually very nice, tidy, and usable. Unfortunately the rest of the review still stands.

locations.address: ÓÉàThe Alan Higgs Centre, Allard Way, Coventry CV3 1HW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Its great that there is such a place ....but it could be so much better.
I use the gym regularly....and regularly come away disappointed.
The equipment is pretty much bog standard.....wouldn't expect anything else tbh.
But....imagine going to a gym and the same music is being played constantly...same songs...same genre of music.
Also ...dotted around the gym they have spray and wipe stations for cleaning down equipment.
Most of the time there is no paper towels plus where they are situated isn't helpful at all.
Better gyms around than this.
showerReviews.author: Paul Griffiths

locations.title: The Wave Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉàNew Union St, Coventry CV1 2PS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been using this gym for long time now and I do enjoy the classes and the gym itself.
However they have 3 swimming lanes, slow, medium and fast. I am a medium pace swimmer, and every time I go, I am effectively forced to go into the fast lane, because people are swimming slower than a medium pace in the medium lane, but kids end up playing in the fast lane. The life guards turn a blind eye to this and don't enforce the rules, or even basic etiquette. I want to train and improve my fittness but I am struggling to do so because of this.
showerReviews.author: Caroline

The swimming pool is pretty bad. How long's it been open and half the changing room lockers are broken?

The pool is extremely short and shallow with 4 narrow lanes. I saw many people swimming wearing PJs, T-shirts etc., lifeguard said nothing.

Because the pool is so small it's quickly crowded and hard to swim. When I went in a heatwave tons of people were just standing chatting and lifeguard didn't care (would be OK if pool wasn't tiny)

They closed the elephant for this?? ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Disappointing when it's the only city centre pool now (and my local pool doesn't open weekends üôÉ)

showerReviews.reviewText: As someone who works all over the UK I‚Äôd say I‚Äôve visited my fair share of pure gyms , you can‚Äôt really go wrong with them , there a flat pack gym you get what you get. This one however is by far the worst. Very very small inside, absolutely 0 control on the number of people inside so was swarmed by large groups of 12-14 year old lads messing around. The changing rooms were equally as small. With it being a new pure gym I was expecting it to be fairly good, but they hadn‚Äôt even taken time to clean off the greasy manufacturers coating on the dumbbells or plates nearly resulting in a nice ‚Äú50‚Äù imprint on my face. Long story short unless you are beyond desperate i wouldn‚Äôt bother, there‚Äôs many other in the area that are great

locations.title: Lutterworth truck stop
locations.address: ÓÉàUnit 2 Watling Cres, Lutterworth LE17 6AR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant!
My mate jason introduced me to this truckstop as he knows people who work in here from down in Weymouth ,he said it was 10/10 and was spot on.
Your always greeted with a smile at the gate to book in from 24/7 security and then chaperoned to your space by the bubbley banksman.
Once settled in your in theres no traffic in n out all night its super quiet with no fridges!!  Very clean Great  showers with a seperate personal changing room to freshen up after a long days trucking.Then you can go into the nice truckers restaurant for a home cooked meal from the extensive menu.There is a pool table n dart board with nice sofas and a huge tv to relax also.
Self service complimentary hot drinks toast provided through the night with some chocolate snacks to start the day off."dont take the piss as some "truckers have apparently "!!
All in all a truckstop built for  truckers and one of the very best in uk . üòäüòäüëåüèºüëåüèº
showerReviews.author: James Paterson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brilliant truck stop!

5 minutes from the M1 in a secure, quiet and spacious place. Friendly and helpful staff with snap account welcome.

No cafe as such but there is an on-site catering van serving until 8pm with a good choice of food and looks nice and hygienic.

There is free tea, coffee and biscuits after 8pm along with a tv room and pool table.

Toilets and showers are very clean.
Hidden gem of a place.
showerReviews.author: Chris Barton

showerReviews.reviewText: Brilliant little truck stop, just off the A5. Parking organised depending on type of trailer and departure time, Snap account for parking, card payment also available. The ladies toilets and shower were immaculate, there was even a hairdryer. The food was delicious, one of the best meals I've had. An extensive menu, all freshly cooked, free coffee, tea, and toast. If you are in the area definitely one to head for, I'll certainly be back

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped off here for a bite to eat, in our motorhome.
Although it's a truckstop car's and Motorhomes are welcome here.
If you want to stop overnight during the week you would have to pay the HGV rate, which is around ¬£23. At weekends the price is negotiable, although the cafe isn't open, but there are still toilets, showers and 24 hour security.
Everything was very clean.
The food was good home cooked meals, which were huge and piping hot. I had the special sauagemeat and sage pie, with mashed potatoes, cabbage, carrots, peas and gravy, plus 2 slices of bread and butter and a mug of tea, lovely.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth Jackson

showerReviews.reviewText:
There are so many problems with this accommodation which is very disappointing. The pipes always make loud squeaking and whistling sounds at midnight and it drives you crazy. You have to go through a stupid amount of automatic doors and the key system breaks down weekly.

There are only a few vacuum cleaner for the 3 blocks so you will have to lift the heave vacuum all across the accommodation to your room, then lift it all the way back to return it.

The accommodation doesn‚Äôt even provide you with basic stuff like kettles, toasters or trash bags. You will expect them from such an expensive accommodation but apparently not.

What finally drove me to write this review is that fact that there is no hot water in shower for the past 4 days now, which is unacceptable in such a freezing weather.

locations.title: Sky Blue Point - Coventry Student Accommodation
locations.address: ÓÉàCoventry CV1 5EE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê Highly Recommended ‚Äì Sky Blue Point, Coventry

I recently moved into Sky Blue Point, Coventry, and I wanted to leave a review for anyone who may be looking for an en-suite room, whether you are a student, foundation student, or a working professional.

From the moment I moved in, my experience has been very positive. I‚Äôve had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Gemma, who is extremely friendly, approachable, and always goes above and beyond to help with any questions or issues. She genuinely makes you feel supported. The reception team, Rachel and Amis, are also fantastic‚Äîvery welcoming, helpful, and professional.

The room itself is great and well-equipped. It includes an en-suite bathroom, a comfortable bed, wardrobe and cupboards, and a study desk, which is perfect for studying or working from home.

One of the standout features of this accommodation is the strong focus on safety. There is 24/7 on-site security as well as CCTV cameras installed throughout the building and around the property, which really gives peace of mind. The security staff are always available, day or night, and are very helpful if you need assistance or have any questions.

The property also offers parking facilities, including disabled parking, as well as bike racks outside with metal frames where you can securely lock your bike.

All the facilities are clean, modern, and well maintained. There is a 24/7 on-site gym, a common room where you can relax and watch TV, a quiet study room, and a small entertainment room downstairs. There is also a laundry facility on-site, which is very convenient‚Äîyou can wash your clothes whenever it suits you.

The accommodation includes a shared kitchen, usually shared between 6‚Äì7 tenants, which is spacious and works well.

Another great benefit is the broadband internet available throughout the building. This makes things very convenient, especially if you have poor phone network or no signal at times‚Äîyou can always rely on the Wi-Fi, which works really well.

The location is excellent. Coventry University is only a five-minute walk away, and there are shops, restaurants, and takeaways nearby, making everyday life very convenient.

Overall, I‚Äôm genuinely very happy with my stay so far. The staff are incredibly friendly and always willing to help, the facilities are excellent, and the atmosphere is welcoming. I would highly recommend Sky Blue Point to anyone looking for quality accommodation in Coventry. I honestly couldn‚Äôt ask for more.
showerReviews.author: WAJ LTD

Another great benefit is the broadband internet available throughout the building. This makes things very convenient, especially if you have poor phone network or no signal at times‚Äîyou can always rely on the Wi-Fi, which works really well.

The location is excellent. Coventry University is only a five-minute walk away, and there are shops, restaurants, and takeaways nearby, making everyday life very convenient.

Overall, I‚Äôm genuinely very happy with my stay so far. The staff are incredibly friendly and always willing to help, the facilities are excellent, and the atmosphere is welcoming. I would highly recommend Sky Blue Point to anyone looking for quality accommodation in Coventry. I honestly couldn‚Äôt ask for more.
showerReviews.author: WAJ LTD

locations.title: Bishop Gate Student Accommodation
locations.address: ÓÉàTower St, Coventry CV1 1AJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a former postgraduate international student, I would recommend you live here. If you are someone who prefers privacy (like me) go for their deluxe studio rooms, mine was on the second floor so if ever the elevators were not working I didn‚Äôt have to struggle at all.

The laundry service requires money obviously lol, I think I spent ¬£2,50 for washer and dryer per load. Make sure you download the app and check machines are working before selecting one (refunds can take long).

Maintenance comes by periodically throughout the year to make sure certain things are still maintained. If you have any issues report them to reception. Also make sure you move in at a time where reception is still open because if there are any problems security can‚Äôt really assist much.

I think you are allowed a maximum of two visitors at a time if I‚Äôm not wrong and if you have visitors sleeping over there is a form you have to fill out.

Tesco Express is literally at your door step, the bus station and Sainsbury‚Äôs are about a street away. There is a Puregym opposite the the building for all the fitness bunnies. The canal route is literally on the other side of the building, you have to climb up the stairs and you‚Äôll be there.

There is also a shop (Delta Supermarket) around the corner that sells all your African necessities Iwisa, Robertsons spices etc.
showerReviews.author: Babedi Kgotleng

locations.title: Chogan City Stays

showerReviews.reviewText:
Pros: Check in was self service but very simple and easy. Free parking. Room was modern, clean and very well equipped. Lots of towels. Loved having a kitchenette. Distance to Coventry building society Arena was perfect, a quick walk.

Cons: The property is on a busy road. The room was uncomfortably hot. It was impossible to sleep with the windows open due to the road noise. There was a fan provided but not enough to reduce the temperature of the room.

I would stay here again due to cost, property style and distance to event. Appreciate the owner cant do anything about location/road but could combat how hot the property gets in the summer.

Thank you again

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic gem of a site. We initially chose this because they would accept our XL Bully as many sites don't. The staff are extremely friendly and many of the visitors are regular and repeat campers and we can see why. It's far enough away from major towns to be rural and peaceful but close enough if you want to explore. The site is well maintained with a dog walking area, ball park, games room and a 9 hole putting green. There is also a fishing pond which was very popular with visitors. The toilet/shower blocks were always kept clean and tidy. There is a small shop onsite to get any basics you need to stock up on along with a few extras such as toys etc. Back to the XL Bully point for those who may be put off...from what I understand it's not necessarily a blanket policy. If you abide by the rules and your dog is well behaved, as we do and ours is, you will be allowed to stay but if you flout the rules or your dog causes issues you will be asked to leave and as an XL owner I think that's a very fair and balanced view to take. She doesn't often get the chance to socialise because people walk the other way but so many visitors stopped to ask if they could fuss her, which was fantastic for her development. We will definitely be returning, with or without the dogs.
showerReviews.author: Sonia Davies

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic gem of a site. We initially chose this because they would accept our XL Bully as many sites don't. locations.address: ÓÉàNightingales Farm, Atherstone CV9 2JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Liked: Beautiful farmers field, stayed for one night. Charlotte is lovely & made us feel very welcome. Farm shop, wood, toilets, showers, kettle, microwave, fridge and hot water. Was so nice waking up to the little calves grasing in pasture in the morning. Would definitely recommend & return
showerReviews.author: Susan M.

showerReviews.reviewText: Liked: Beautiful farmers field, stayed for one night. Charlotte is lovely & made us feel very welcome. Farm shop, wood, toilets, showers, kettle, microwave, fridge and hot water. Was so nice waking up to the little calves grasing in pasture in the morning. Would definitely recommend & return
showerReviews.author: Susan M.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is awesome, the staff were so friendly. We stayed for a night to celebrate a friends birthday and this place was perfect. They have 3 separate fields, one for families, one for relaxing and one for social gatherings. The atmosphere on the social field was awesome, everyone chatting and having a good time. The music cut off was 2am on that field which everyone stuck to. The field is spacious and this is one of the few places that doesn't charge per tent which is perfect for groups with multiple tents.

There are plenty of portaloos on the field which were kept clean and staff came to check everyone was having a good time throughout the night. The farm shop on site was really good, the meat was awesome and they also sell fire wood too. And there's a toilet and shower block by the ship. The only reason I couldn't give this place a 5* is the toilet/shower blocks were a little worn and not great, our group skipped using the shower for the night however it didn't put a dampener on the day in any way.

Love this place and would come again
showerReviews.author: Steph Walker

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
An absolute hidden gem......a lovely little site with its own little woods...enclosed in tress...lovely to walk around with our dog...with benches ...fantastic to make your morning coffee and just enjoy sitting outside in nature
There are open countryside walks close by. Barbara and Susan the owners  are just lovely people and keep the site beautiful. There are toilets and shower on site, washing up station, rubbish and recycling bin, water tap and elan point. This site is adults only...and dogs welcome. This is our 2nd visit and will definitely be returning.

locations.title: Holiday Inn Birmingham M6, JCT.7 by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàChapel Ln, Great Barr, Birmingham B43 7BG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worst hotel ever i have stayed in and would never waste my money again. I would love to give it -10 stars.
First check in is at 3pm i checked in at 4 on sunday,i felt the receptionist had a bad day or tired of this job.no smile no greetings nothing.i have read quite alot of reviews i read kids got activity packs.my 2 kids were given nothing.and she told me to pay i put my card in it wasnt reading my card she just ignored me for 2 mins.i asked her what time does the pool close she lied and said 6.
When i got my key she didnt tell me properly where to go she just mumbled.
No lift !!!
Stairs dirty mop bucket left on staires saw a pepsi empty can on stairs.
Room could be much better tiny bathroom with shower no bath tub booked the same room holiday inn near the airport good size bathroom with bathtub and a small fridge.
No fridge no coffee machine pillows outdated mattreses outdated.
Anyway was told 6pm the pool closes just thinking i have 1 hour to swim i went to find the swimming pool.couldnt find it asked receptionist she was rued and didnt instruct properly.was finding it for 15 mins.
I asked regural customers i was told it closes at 8.
Swimming pool not a good size especialy with alot of guests.
Next day had breakfast chef aswell no smile no welcoming when i asked him something no smile nothing  and went to swim after enjoying swimming for a little while they started taking more then half of the pool for fitness classes.and give us a tiny bit we agreed and was still happy.
But the lady there came up to me and told me you are not swimming you have to swim or get out for 45mins.
I said what!! I am swimming she said no ur playing about if you want to stay u swim round and round.the man aswell kept on telling me to get out.
I said theres other people and kids there just standing around go tell them aswell she said yeah im going and she didnt she lied and ran away.was that racism ?
I got so angry after all that i just got out the pool and went to get ready took my daughter out.she wanted 2 swim more
Check out was at 11 i had packed all my stuff already so i can swim and took it down with me 10.30 i remembered i forgot something went back room was already clean.how ??
Can u clean a room before check out time ?
Its not allowed.iv worked in ibis i know how it works.
11 is my check out thats still my room mybe i wanted to go back 2 shower or anything?
Thats just out of the question to clean a room before check out.
Im sorry to say train your staff or change your staff!!!
To smile to greet to be helpfull its not only me iv seen alot of bad reviews of your staff.
Staff are getting payed to make our stay happy and comfortable.
Unhappy staff = unhappy customer.
And if u want to go on with fitness clubs you do a time 4 them so they are not distracted and we can swim bec we have all payed.or make another private swimming pool.
I heard 2 ladies really complaining paying alot of money for the club and lots of men looking at them and to much noise e.t.c
If anyone reads this il recommend you to go birm holiday inn near the airport.
Freindly staff , lift ,clean stairs , big room and bathroom ,bathtub ,fridge ,coffee machine,big swimming pool,very clean hotel,the hotel is much appealing to look at.
I really enjoyed my stay there and they even have a car to pick you.
showerReviews.author: kulsum Juma

Need signage up to BE QUIET. I was next to an exit door that needed oiling. Wedged open fire doors by swimming pool. Cold draft running under door. Used towels. Breakfast was good. Fresh ingredients. Only downside. Poached eggs done in far too much vinegar. Yuk. Didn't have twice. Would stay again

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic site for a multitude of reasons: the site is very clean and tidy, the facilities (toilet, shower, shop and laundry rooms) are immaculate, most pitches have there own water, electricity and drainage, all of which are easily accessible. The people who run/own the site are very friendly and approachable should you need assistance, if not they leave you to it, hence self catering accommodation. The site location is perfectly suited as it is far away enough to have the benefits of rural life (peace, quiet and nice views), yet still close enough to Atherstone town centre that I need walk only 15mins. Highly recommended.
showerReviews.author: Ludwig Amadeus Wagner

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here 3 nights in January 2017 and it's fantastic!
25 mins drive to Kingsbury Water Park for fantastic dog walks.
THE best showers I have had on a site.
Spotless and we'll mentioned - AND ARE FREE! Don't be misled by the old scanned map that says ¬£1 showers.
Also there is a large laundry room with fresh farm eggs - ¬£1.20 for 6 / ¬£2 for 12. Bargain!
Good signal on both EE and 3 networks for phone and 4G coverage.
Large pitches, friendly people and horses!
Don't think twice, this is lovely and so quiet........
Will be back again one day I'm sure.
Can't fault it, we'll done.
showerReviews.author: Mark Lannister

showerReviews.reviewText: Glamping pod was very clean and spacious, bed was comfortable and shower  was great.  I've been to place where we have had a pod and had to share camping site shower facilities, it was great to have our own bathroom. We also had family in next pod, they came round in evening for card games, enough room for all of us round a table. site very clean and quite at night.
showerReviews.author: Olwen Capper

showerReviews.reviewText: Glamping pod was very clean and spacious, bed was comfortable and shower  was great.  I've been to place where we have had a pod and had to share camping site shower facilities, it was great to have our own bathroom. showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for one night with our folding camper (delighted to find a site that didn't require caravan club membership!) and were impressed with the size and flatness of the pitches (chunky gravel underfoot), each with mains hookup and standpipe.

It seemed surprising that for such a big campsite there were only 2 toilets and 2 showers, but having said that, we never had to queue even though the site was more than half full. And the facilities were really clean and the showers were great - decent flow and they don't keep switching off either.

The only drawback to the site is the distance to the facilities, and we were one of the closest pitches. I'd have given them 5 stars for making a walk way through the barbed wire fence and strip of woodland right behind our pitch, because it would have halved the distance to the toilets!
showerReviews.author: Julie Brazier

We had a water issue one morning where the sinks and showers weren‚Äôt draining, myself and another pod user informed management and the issue was resolved within 30 minutes, our day wasn‚Äôt affected by this incident and it was handled professionally and timely.

I would recommend a stay here to anyone looking for a little adventurous getaway.

locations.title: Lime Tree Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàLimes Farm, Main Road, Ratcliffe Culey, Atherstone CV9 3PD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped here with a vw club , wow what a superb little site , what this site has to offer is amazing and very quiet.
The facilities for a site of this size is 5 stars
Toilets ( male female and excess able) so clean you would think they were new.
Showers x2 ( male + female and one excess able ) , lovely and hot .
And a laundry room ( washing machine and tumble dryer + plus a wash up area ) again with hot water.
I would thoroughly recommend this site for walkers and those that want to explore.
All pitches have electricity and water
showerReviews.author: Adrian Hardiman

showerReviews.reviewText: Really neat site with good hardstanding and clean, well kept shower/toilet facilities. Rosemary was really helpful and there's a pub 6/7 minutes down the road. We stayed in February and there were a total of 12 motorhomes/caravans on site. The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is I think the toilet block would likely be a little small if any more pitches were taken, with only 2 unisex toilets and 2 unisex showers available. Other than that, highly recommended.

locations.title: Holiday Inn Birmingham Airport - Nec by IHG
locations.address: ÓÉàCoventry Rd, Birmingham B26 3QW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stay a lot in hotels all over the UK and this is the best hotel I stay at. I‚Äôve been staying here for around five years when I‚Äôm in Birmingham.
The rooms are great, good TVs, coffee machines, fridges and a very good shower.
The bar area is good as well as food in the restaurant. The best part though,has to be the staff, they are all different to most I encounter  at rival hotels,which is a credit to themselves as well as the training they have from management. I can‚Äôt remember all their names but on reception, Honey is brilliant, so are Shiwani and Megan, you can‚Äôt beat a smile and a happy helpful persona when you check in. They are great Girls and very professional but with a personal touch. Mo who is F&B manager has a great team, including Tiya, Twinkle and Manisha. The Breakfast in the morning is very good, brilliantly run by Charleen who has been at the hotel for a good few years. I cannot fault this hotel and always look forward to my visits there. Huge credit to Jaime, his management team and the wonderful staff that make this hotel what it is. Look forward to my next visit in the New Year, best regards Colin
showerReviews.author: Huw Puw

showerReviews.reviewText:
Avoid this centre at all costs. The staff members have stolen my coat, my sons hat and my mom's swimming costume.
A lady called JESS stole my coat. She told me it was at the centre after me leaving it behind due to rushing for the taxi and it was thundering outside: I rang back a few days later and I was informed my coat is not there. Jess then confirmed it was brought into the centre but she "doesn't know" what happened after that as she left it on the main desk for others to come and steal also.
I spoke with the MALE manager who was USELESS! He told me that my coat is missing and nothing he can do DESPITE being told by Jess that it was handed in which means one of the WORKERS here have stolen my coat. Embarrassing! I am very disappointed and I will not be returning to this centre.
Some people also say it's very dirty inside...
Some of the swimming instructors look fed up with life and don't want to do their job.
showerReviews.author: Parris Harvey

I promised to keep you informed if there were improvements:
The areas from reception leading into changing rooms and swimming/sauna/steam room is much warmer.  Water is clear and inviting.
Swimming lessons are available for all age groups. Hot Tubs water is still not so Hot but much better than before.
The floor was still wet and slippery so caution when walking through from changing rooms leading to the swimming area,  (would need constant clearing away of the excess water).
20p for use of hair dryer!

Free Parking is available, you can book online for your swimming lessons/sessions or join the gym. It is a lovely place to be.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The positives first: The gym has recently had updated equipment installed, the staff are mostly friendly and helpful, good variety of classes if that's your thing.

The negatives: When the steam or sauna goes down, it stays down for a good while. The cleanliness isn't the best, downstairs changing room I'd expect to get stinky with the amount of kids running though despite the one guy I see constantly cleaning but the upstairs changing room constantly smells like old socks, the showers are filthy, the toilets are often blocked and the steamroom despite getting cleaned regularly pongs to high heaven.

The prices have/are increasing not sure it's worth it for much longer

showerReviews.reviewText: I hadn't been swimming for over 20 years and was basically told by my wife i was going. Lol. I turned up at Central Baths with new shorts in hand and went in. At reception, i paid my ¬£4 and a very helpful lady directed me through the entering procedure. I went into the changing rooms, got sorted, and locked my clothes away in the lockers. Strapped the key to my wrist and went poolside. There were a handful of people in the actual pool. Great atmosphere, and after a couple of hours, i got out. The pool was a lovely temperature, and the life guards were very observant. I thoroughly enjoyed my time in the pool and will be going again. I have since found out that over 60's are  tenner a month. Absolute bargain.
showerReviews.author: Paul Hallam

showerReviews.reviewText:
My son has been having swimming lessons for over 1 year at berts and I couldnt be happier with the improvement I've seen!
My son suffers with APD and additional needs but has built up an amazing friendship with his instructor Charlotte and now refuses to learn with a different teacher.
I can't praise and thank Charlotte enough for the time and effort she puts in with him. Nothing is to much trouble for her & it's heart warming to see my son forge a relationship with her. Definitely a credit to the centre.

showerReviews.reviewText: experienced discrimination from a staff member. i was told to leave an adult swim session completely unfairly and was spoken to in a disgusting manner and was left in tears. i am genuinely not someone who complains but i am 23 years old and have sciatica, i can swim comfortably but i was using a kick board float (which is completely allowed!) so that i could use my legs more as it helps with my pain. using these does make you swim slower because you‚Äôre not using your arms, and i was at a point where i wasn‚Äôt moving much for a few seconds. otherwise, i was swimming normally and was not keeping anyone up. a blonde female lifeguard who looked probably younger than me pulled me aside and told me very condescendingly this was for ‚Äòadults only‚Äô who could swim. saying things like ‚Äòdo you know this is for adults?‚Äô i will say now, me and my partner both look a lot younger than we are, so i‚Äôm pretty sure she spoke to me this way because i look younger. we were even asked by the desk if we were over 16 to be allowed into this session. she kept reiterating this point and i was getting embarrassed. she told me i needed to tread water for 30 seconds in front of her which i began to and she started smirking. at this point i felt so upset that i stopped, as people were watching me, and she loudly announced that i needed to leave the pool and told me i only tread water for 12 seconds, even though it was obvious i manually stopped. my partner saw the uncomfortable interaction and asked her if there was a problem which she proceeded to argue with him and tell him that i needed swimming lessons despite not asking me if i could even swim a lap (which i confidently can). she also made up a time limit for the slow lane which is not mentioned anywhere on your website. i was honestly mortified and just left, crying in the changing room from how she spoke to me and humiliated me in front of people including my friends who were swimming with us. my partner managed to get us a refund as we had only been in the pool less than 10 minutes!!! This has completely crushed my confidence. my swimming is not pretty by any means but it is safe. i wanted to build the social confidence and was scared to get started and her handling of this situation (which was about 2 months ago now) has left me avoiding swimming altogether even though it helps my pain. What has made me most angry is that i have been to this pool before. there is adult/elderly swimmers who cannot swim a lap and take long breaks. my friend said a man came in after we left and kept stopping mid-length and this life guard said NOTHING to him. i believe i was treated this way because she deemed me to be a teenager, which would make it wrong still anyways! i‚Äôm actually quite an anxious/quiet person and really hate confrontation which may be obvious from how i handled it in the moment, but people close to me advised i send an email/write a review. i thought I‚Äôd give a chance and just send an email first, so i sent a genuinely polite email to Bert Williams and wv active with hopes that they would care about something like this, and i was ignored, so that shows you enough. i know they received my email as i got a confirmation saying they would reply soon‚Ä¶ two months later and nothing. disgusting place, and upon telling friends and family they have reconsidered getting memberships.
showerReviews.author: Amy Hewitt

showerReviews.reviewText: experienced discrimination from a staff member. i was told to leave an adult swim session completely unfairly and was spoken to in a disgusting manner and was left in tears. showerReviews.reviewText: My child goes to swimming lessons, whilst this doesn‚Äôt happen to my child, I have observed a particular swimming teacher be rude to some of the children. She needs to remember these children are 3,4,5 years of age, they aren‚Äôt always going to get it right. The teacher Charlotte, shakes her head often and likes to embarass children infront of spectators, this will make a child lose confidence if continued and feel embarassed. Please consider observing the nature in which she teaches and maybe she should review her approach, all children are different and learn at different paces! The app where you can check a child progress is not always up to date and it should be to help aid conversations with your child. This is my honest opinion.

showerReviews.reviewText: Great community gym. Football pitches indoor (have played 5 aside here for years) and outdoor with stadium pitch available. Scam!!!

showerReviews.reviewText:
What incredible staff at this centre!
We booked an aqua mayhem party for my daughter‚Äôs 13th and she had the best time ever. The booking process was friendly, easy and helpful. We had all the required info on age ranges, and they insisted that every child wears a life jacket, so non-swimmers don‚Äôt stand out from swimmers. There were 3-4 lifeguards helping the kids throughout and they were such fun, splashing the kids and encouraging them to have as much fun as possible.
You can hire a party room afterwards which they had laid out beautifully with lights to match the music tempo, and Bluetooth connectivity to play your own playlists. Lots of chairs, clean tables and large changing rooms and toilets.
Every member of staff that passed us asked how they could help and were just genuinely welcoming and lovely.
I cannot recommend this place enough, they made a special birthday even more special.
Thank you all for the fantastic service.
showerReviews.author: Nicola Dixon

showerReviews.reviewText: I've recently moved here from being with a previous gym for 3 years so I felt it really needed to "tick" the boxes for me. I LOVE this gym, it has a great vibe, its never too busy even at peak times, it's very clean and thr machines are spaced out very well. I manage to get on all the equipment I want to use with ease. The equipment is nee and maintained well. The womens changing rooms have large lockers, are very clean and the shower cubicles are spacious. They have a hair dryer and straightener so you could easily do a morning session and get ready for work with ease. The only thing they need is a full length mirror. For the price you pay, classes are included too so you can't really go wrong with going here. Definitely worth moving here.

showerReviews.reviewText: This used to be a really nice gym some years ago but these days it's extremely over-subscribed and overpriced, yet the facilities are falling into a really manky state. The pool has swimming lessons every single evening and Saturdays which I think is a cheek given that these classes are paid and the cost of membership is so high. So as well as the fact that there's less pool for members to use, it has the atmosphere of a public baths with constant shouting from the poolside. It also looks like a rough leisure centre now with rust and peeling paint everywhere. And...It's so expensive! Where is the money going?The gym floor is sub par and the classes are always full, the popular ones are booked up all the way up to the limit of how far ahead you can book, so that's something I'm paying for that I can't even get. The gym floor is the only thing that doesn't feel overcrowded but I can get better facilities from a budget chain gym if I just wanted that, and for a fraction of the price. Needless to say I'm looking for a better deal, I really feel robbed.
showerReviews.author: Zoe Sullivan

showerReviews.reviewText: This used to be a really nice gym some years ago but these days it's extremely over-subscribed and overpriced, yet the facilities are falling into a really manky state. showerReviews.reviewText:
Disappointing, Unsafe, and Lacking Support at Nuffield Baby Swimming Trial

I recently took my daughter to a trial swimming lesson at Nuffield, a class specific for babies, and the experience was both disappointing and concerning. We were placed in the deep end without being informed, which made my 1-year-old daughter uncomfortable and distressed. The instructor did not come over at all to offer support or guidance. Instead, she simply waved for my mum to bring my daughter over to the other children‚Äîexpecting them to move from the deep end to the shallow end on their own, which was both unrealistic and dangerous.

At no point were we advised to start in the shallow end, nor was any effort made to accommodate my daughter‚Äôs discomfort. My mum had to take her out of the lesson early, and the instructor showed no concern or interest. It felt dismissive, and it‚Äôs difficult not to question whether this had anything to do with the fact that we were the only people of colour in the class.

On top of this, a stranger‚Äîa man‚Äîapproached my mum and asked if she needed help getting out of the pool. Given that this was a designated children's and baby swimming class, this interaction felt odd and raised concerns about security within the facility.

Safety and inclusivity should be top priorities in swimming lessons, especially for young children, and this experience did not reflect that at all. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this class to parents looking for a supportive and secure environment for their child‚Äôs first experience in the pool. Avoid at all costs!
showerReviews.author: Mani Bhogal

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cancelled my membership after 4 months.  Tried for 9 days to arrange PT sessions and everytime a call back promised, no one called back.  I run my own businesses and if a potential customer was chasing me to part with their cash for my services I would be very embarassed.  Far too busy at times, and the mens changing rooms benches constantly covered in white protein powder.  Also outdoor swimming pool not very well kept at all.  For the price they charge for memberships it really is not worth the cost.
Positives though, lots of equipment if can find a time it is not busy, nice coffee shop/cafe, and most the staff very friendly.
showerReviews.author: Noel Wildman

They want a bill or rent agreement but if you move in with someone and its their place how are you supposed to get that when everything is in their name? Send debt collection agencies after you pretty much straight away.

The gym isn't even very good, too busy so you can't get on any machines and the locker rooms are dirty and smell. Sauna and steam rooms arent hot enough. Much better options out there, nowhere near worth the fee. Stay well clear.

showerReviews.reviewText: Another great branch of JD Gym in main centre Wolverhampton, this gym is a one floor layout gym with all cardio machines available as well as resistance machines as well as climbing frames, they also have an excellent free weights area with many pieces of equipment available ie bench‚Äôs plates barbells dumbbells etc as well as cable machines and a large cable machine located at the back of the gym. The changing rooms seem to be one of the cleanest of the Midlands franchise, and the sauna seems to be one of the top 2 best saunas in the whole jd franchise in the West Midlands, the parking issues here seems to be sorted but I guess at busy times you will have a problem with parking, you get 3 hours if you add your car reg inside the gym on the iPad located at the front desk, if not you only have 2 hours of free parking before you get a fine sent to your door. The gym is suitable for PWDs and others in that category. The staff seem pretty decent also and the gym users seem kind and genuine, top scores from me and keep up the good work JDs gym your doing an excellent job with the gyms‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: I really love coming here, the staff are always so friendly and inviting, however. What really lets this place down is the provision for female truckers like myself who might want somewhere to stop for the night. So last night I decided to stop and get a shower, not the best choice I've made, motorway services and other truck stops offer far better. To get access you have to go through the men's, then you have 2 separate rooms, one toilet, one shower. The shower itself was a little dire, shower head needs replacing as it delivers a torrent of water instead of an actual shower. The extractor fan in there doesn't work either so you're left in a stifling box room and can't open the door until you're fully dressed as it opens into the men's toilet/shower area. Which BTW, the men get 5 shower cubicles, 3 sinks, a full width mirror and hot air dryer for drying hands with. Oh and 2 toilet bowls which thankfully is hidden behind the door. I did mention it to the lovely lady last night who was quite helpful. Come on though guys, more women like myself might stay the night if it was known you actually cater for lady truckers. The poor offering we get right now isn't an offering, it's an insult.
showerReviews.author: Reena's World

showerReviews.reviewText:
as a Trucker.  It‚Äôs average small welcome Break. Ok for a stop but not for much else.
HGV parking charge is a ripoff for what you get (30¬£ without vouchers 33¬£ with). Due to the showers being worse than a prison/ barracks, due no bench or much space to change or wash basin .
There‚Äôs NO WiFi in the truck park, let alone only having one bar of signal(yes phone providers limit) but charging hotel prices it should be expected.
Truck parking is on a hill, not the worst but not ideal.
Very limited hot food options eg burger King or the shop deli or a coffee shop. There is a Waitrose.
No quiet area if busy bar retreating back to the truck .
Some of what I‚Äôve mentioned can be mentioned of the mainstream services and gets put down by some proper truck stops that have WiFi and decent showers and decent cafe with healthy and much better price options. But few off around.

Personally I think around 15¬£ a night would be better with a 6¬£ meal voucher and that‚Äôs pushing it.
33¬£ I can book into a hotel with way better facilities and value for money.
I would like to remind services with out trucks you would have nothing to sell or provide. And even if are employers will repay us it‚Äôs still a lot to ask.
I doubt any main stream service will take on my points I have said, and I‚Äôve tried to be fair and honest but if you charge top whack you‚Äôre going to be judged by that. But I hope by fare reviewing sites it will possibly aid in the future of improving are industry and how truck drivers/humens are treated and ripped off for doing there job and complaining with strict rules.
showerReviews.author: Stevo One

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well, it's OK, but not vastly impressed.

The toilets were being cleaned when we got there, which is good. But the first tap I tried didn't work, then I had to try to wash my hands under a dribble of water from another tap. The hand dryers look high tech, but keep switching off after a few seconds, very annoying.

I was able to get a decaf soya latte from Starbucks, but would have to go over the bridge to get groceries from Waitrose, escalator one way, only steps the other, no lift. Very poor accessibility, not an option for me.
showerReviews.author: Mike Bird

showerReviews.reviewText:
During my 3 nights here, I had only 1 real complaint. That was the noise. Situated directly at the side of a main crossroads with a heavy flow of traffic, was not ideal. I could hear the traffic any time I was in the room, evening, middle of night, early morning etc.
The main reason I could hear all this so much was probably due to the windows still being of wooden structure and not updated to pvc double glazing, this also affected the warmth a little, but there was a decent sized radiator to accommodate this.

The room itself was very neat and clean. Once you‚Äôve dealt with the shared toilet/shower/kitchen, it doesn‚Äôt really bother you.

I can recommend this place, based on its location for what I needed it for(completing AM2 assessment at the near ERR centre).
However, if you are going to stay here, bring some ear plugs.
showerReviews.author: Tom Moreton

showerReviews.reviewText:
During my 3 nights here, I had only 1 real complaint. That was the noise. Situated directly at the side of a main crossroads with a heavy flow of traffic, was not ideal. I could hear the traffic any time I was in the room, evening, middle of night, early morning etc.
The main reason I could hear all this so much was probably due to the windows still being of wooden structure and not updated to pvc double glazing, this also affected the warmth a little, but there was a decent sized radiator to accommodate this.

The room itself was very neat and clean. Once you‚Äôve dealt with the shared toilet/shower/kitchen, it doesn‚Äôt really bother you.

I can recommend this place, based on its location for what I needed it for(completing AM2 assessment at the near ERR centre).
However, if you are going to stay here, bring some ear plugs.
showerReviews.author: Tom Moreton

locations.title: Fiveways House - iQ Student Accommodation Wolverhampton
locations.address: ÓÉàFiveways Hall, 26 North Rd, Wolverhampton WV1 1HR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for the first time in my second year, had a nice flat with 2 other strangers.
Upon arrival was first to arrive, had an easy turnover and move in.
Loved the kitchen, everything looked new from the oven to the induction hob. I really liked the modern upgrade and cosiness it had. Unfortunately because of the space of the kitchen there was only ever enough room for one person to cook at a time, which I personally didn't mind as me and my flatmates barely ran into eachother. I was also very fortunate to have one of the flatmates that would help clean up the place with me so we didn't have such a messy kitchen.

As for the room, upon arrival it looked pretty good, had more space than the official university accommodation as well as another private accommodation that almost everyone used. Having lived at the university one for 2 years, visited the other tall private accommodation numerous times. This one by far was the best stay, and I have to thank the staff for it too as they were always friendly, helpful, and very accomodating to every need I had, whether in person or through the accomodation's app.

I also really appreciated that they have a cashback scheme which was definitely the biggest reason I decided to check them out, and eventually book with them.

I also understand that a lot of the mess people refer to in staying in accomodation is simply down to the fact they themselves and/or their flatmates do not have the skills to clean up after themselves or respect the place they live in as well the people around who use the same space.

The most important factor for people picking their accommodation is the quality of the room, for reference the Flat i stayed at in block A, the cheapest room available, the bed was a wooden built in frame so it was secure and there was also no creaks, very sturdy, made of thick materials even down to where the bed laid on top of. It also provided underbed storage which could be accessed by lifting the mattress: good for storage of suitcases, boxes you wouldn't need till the very end when moving out.
The toilet is smaller than the other 2 accomodation's I've stayed at before but enough space for one person at a time.
The closet was a standard size similar to all other accomodation's and had compartments on the lower 1 side.
Unfortunately my room was a corner of the building so I only had half a desk space compared to others, so keep in mind when choosing your room, do so via a desktop so you can choose which room you want exactly, the floor layout, distance from kitchen etc. (Also really appreciated that feature as other accomodation's wouldnt let you pick the location of your room, just the type).
Radiator location of that room was a tad bit inconvenient as it would get too hot when you're working at the desk, another downside was the windows having spiders outside it. So i lived in fear of leaving it open for long incase bugs came in but fortunately they didn't.
Sound proofing, you can hear people when they come into the flat, every noise made. Doors are heavy and close automatically for safety and are slow release but still make a noise but the kitchen one in particular. I didn't have any wall neighbours only above and below. Could hear heavy walking from above but not music or anything. Below neighbours I heard nothing.
Flatmates I can hear if its silent in my room and they're shouting through a headset. Can also hear you too if you're having a normal conversation in your room and you're in the corridor. I had the kitchen next door so I did hear noises and muffled conversation, chairs moving but only when the room is quiet at night. But in essence, you can hear if your flatmates are in if you listen for them. Tbf we were all quiet flatmates.

Big plus to my room was the sunrise view in the morning come spring-summer time.

Overall find little to no fault in the accomodation and their services. Fave feature was knowing when washing machines were available so you don't come down with a load only to find out all 5 are used.
showerReviews.author: J

locations.title: Redwings Lodge Wolverhampton
locations.address: ÓÉà45 Waterloo Rd, Wolverhampton WV1 4QL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed in multiple rooms over a 6 week duration for work:

- Biggest problem is inability to sleep due to noise: most rooms face out to the main road; windows are entirely non-sound proofed. It feels as though the window is wide open. You WILL get woken early by road traffic. Final night I upgraded to a room facing away from the main road, only to be woken by a drunk bunch of hotel guests loitering drinking at the back entrance for about an hour who pretty much woke up the whole building (reception did nothing despite being asked to).
- Rooms all have that dank smell you often get in really cheap lodges; some kind of mix of body odour versus commercial cleaning products.
- WiFi super unstable and unusable from most rooms.
- Each room has a single plug socket, almost always in the most inconvenient location imaginable.
- Breakfast highly variable - one time it was literally just some baked beans and a few grilled mushrooms (along with the usual toaster and bread).
- Lots of rooms have faulty equipment like non-working lights or broken heating heater.
- Rooms will often have finishing supplies; once the room I was in barely had any toilet roll left. Another time there was barely any shower wash left.

The only Positive is the cheap price and central location. You get what you pay for; fine as long as you don't mind likely only getting a few hours of sleep in the most basic room possible, before being abruptly woken up by noise from something or another.
showerReviews.author: Imran Sajid

locations.title: Holcombe House
locations.address: ÓÉà1 Lea Gardens, Wolverhampton WV3 0LX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for two nights. Easy walk from the train station and an easier walk back to the town centre. Great location with a 24 hour McDonald's 2 minutes away for breakfast or late night grub. Room was spotless and very comfortable. Shower room was fine, I had a bit of a mission trying to get a stable temperature in the shower the first time I used it but I strongly suspect other guests were using theirs at the same time and the hot water system was struggling. Second time was fine. Nice little garden out the back to sit with a coffee and listen to the birds. Entry codes were provided in plenty of time and I was made aware of the need for photo ID and a refundable security deposit well in advance. If you read your T's & C's there are no hidden surprises with this place. Very impressed and will definitely book again next time I am stopping in Wolverhampton.

locations.title: Worfe Camping
locations.address: ÓÉàValley Farm, Shifnal TF11 9JN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed at the express pitch on our way up to the Lakes.  Superb spot, great views and all the facilities we required.

Although not hard standing, ground was perfectly level so didn't need to muck around trying to drive up tiny ramps on motorhome.

Toilet, shower and washing up facilities were excellent.  Shower was beautifully clean and warm.  Even provided with shower gel, shampoo and washing up liquid (all good for environment)!

We tried to ensure we left facilities clean but this would have been easier with something to do that with!  Not a criticism, just wanted to leave the facilities as beautifully as we had found them.

Great refuge and recycling (incl dog poo!) facilities.

All in all the perfect 1 night stop over.

Thanks so much.

Harriet, Jo and dogs
showerReviews.author: Harriet Goss

Some nice walks on site & local amenities are never that far away should you need anything.

An excellent experience, and we wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return ! Thank you!

Our hosts greeted us with a positive energy which is always nice and broadened our knowledge of the site and the surrounding area. A peaceful nights sleep under the stars. Your own pitch side shower and flushing toilet is standard. The campsite is able to suggest a variety of activities and comforts if you are staying with children should you run out of ideas as much as the site can leave you be and be free to explore and run with your own ideas. We felt in touch with the environment and will mark down ‚ÄòValley Farm‚Äô as a place to return to in the future. A 5 star retreat from us üòä.

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a great pop up campsite! Cannock Chase just across the road, pizza van serving delicious wood fired pizza Friday and Saturday evenings, pop up shop with food essentials and lots of camping equipment at reasonable prices. Porta cabin showers were fabulous, the toilets do get a bit messy especially as it was raining, and the chemical smell is a bit strong, but everything cleaned regularly. The space is amazing, 2 huge fields, fresh water taps, chemical loo disposal, electric hook ups available and wash up sinks with warm water! All the team were so friendly and welcoming from booking through to being on site. We will be back.
Great for groups and anyone looking for some peace and quiet as space is so big.
showerReviews.author: paula tennyson

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a great pop up campsite! Cannock Chase just across the road, pizza van serving delicious wood fired pizza Friday and Saturday evenings, pop up shop with food essentials and lots of camping equipment at reasonable prices. Porta cabin showers were fabulous, the toilets do get a bit messy especially as it was raining, and the chemical smell is a bit strong, but everything cleaned regularly. The space is amazing, 2 huge fields, fresh water taps, chemical loo disposal, electric hook ups available and wash up sinks with warm water! All the team were so friendly and welcoming from booking through to being on site. We will be back.
Great for groups and anyone looking for some peace and quiet as space is so big.
showerReviews.author: paula tennyson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Such friendly staff who are so accommodating. Hugely appreciated how they were so willing to go the extra mile to ensure we had the most pleasant stay.
The bell tents are absolutely gorgeous with the bunting and fairy lights at the entrance... Really gives the experience that enchanted feeling! The bell tents are spacious, warm, and comfortable.
Really lovely campsite which is clean and family friendly.
Has water available, toilets, showers and a shop in a marquee on site! Perfect activity for all the family or with friends!
Located in the middle of Cannock Chase with plenty of hiking routes available!
Also has chairs, tables, water kegs available.
Willing to cater as well for large groups and will happily spend time with you to select the best part of the campsite for you!
Thank you for giving us such an incredible camping experience!

locations.title: Stanmore Hall Touring Park
locations.address: ÓÉàStourbridge Rd, Bridgnorth WV15 6DT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great campsite we visited for two nights
Very enjoyable quiet at this time of year but with plenty of very friendly fellow campers.
Great hard standing pitch plenty of room for our 8m A class MH
Close enough to Bridgnorth to cycle, had a lovely day riding a steam train on the Severn Valley Railway to Kidderminster and back the a couple of beers in a very friendly town.
Staff on the site were very helpful and the toilets and shower block was immaculate.
The only thing I was a little uncomfortable with was that they allowed one pitch to fly 4 Union/St George flags I am very proud of my country and patriotic but we all know this look has at the moment other connotation .

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for a long weekend, friendly wardens on arrival, and was given the choice of remaining pitches. Washrooms are clean as you would expect from the CC&C club site, smallish site with dog walking field just outside the gates. Nice walk along the canal into Kidderminster. Also, a nice walk into Cooksley the opposite way with a couple of pubs in. Lock inn and the old smithy tearooms short walk away.Wifi and phone connection good. Overall, it's a nice site with some good walks. It was well worth a visit.

locations.title: Cannock Chase Camping & Caravanning Club Site
locations.address: ÓÉàWandon Lodge, The Old Youth Hostel Staffordshire, Rugeley WS15 1QW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Beautiful site in the middle of Cannock Chase. Spotlessly clean facilities (regularly being checked). Plenty of hot water for washing up (under cover). Laundry facilities ¬£3.50 for wash, ¬£1.00 for 20 mins in dryer. (Very clean room/equipment).  Free hot showers (with seat) free hairdryers. Two cubicles with sink and mirror and handwash. Plenty of toilets. Always plenty of toilet roll and hand wash.
Very good accessible shower/toilet, family friendly. Lovely choice of grass or hard standing pitches (level gravel) with or without electric. Well spaced pitches set at different angles so you don't feel too overlooked. Lovely peaceful setting. There is a little background traffic noise at times during the day, (not too intrusive) but not so noticeable after rush hour has passed. Lovely wooden play park with house/slide/swings. Staff are so friendly, helpful and very approachable. All the team work very hard to make your stay as welcoming and relaxing as possible. They obviously take pride in their site - it shows.
Lovely walks all around in the forest. Large supermarkets 10 mins drive.
We regularly use this site each month whilst visiting relatives in the area, and we wouldn't dream of going elsewhere.
Thank you, see you next month üëçüèª
showerReviews.author: Angela Mason

locations.title: Oakland Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàShutt Green Ln, Brewood ST19 9LX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update to the below with honesty in mind
Good points
-kids and  Adults enjoyed the amenities and surroundings, had great time swimming in the pool and enjoyed walking along the canal, observing nature, canal boats
VEGAN pie was delicious at the bar
Great play centre in Brewood village, with VEGAN bubblegum ice-cream
Bad points
The pool would do with a bit of TLC
The bar prices are reasonable, disappointment caused when it turned out that marked as vegan hot dog option contained egg, fries were undercooked one time
The lodge was spacious and well equipped but the cleanliness not up to high standard, found somebody else's socks under cushions on a sofa, lots of dirt and dust especially under beds etc, floors felt sticky
- garden furniture kept in the storage full od dust and cobwebs
Lack of attention to details, we informed in advance that we are on a Vegan diet. On arrival day we found a hospitality tray in the kitchen (nice gesture) that caused distaste due to Eggs, Haribo sweets, butter biscuits and dairy milk offered

We have stayed for 3 nights at the Lodge, that was well designed spacious for family of 4 and well equipped. As others said hospitality tray together with coffee machine was a very nice touch.
The swimming pool rather small and play area tiny but quiet so we have had a nice time. Very reasonably priced also during school holidays.
showerReviews.author: Jadwiga Kozlowska

showerReviews.reviewText:
4 of us spent 4 nights in Newbrook Lodge this month as we were using it as a base to travel to different places such as drayton manor, sealife, birmingham and a few other places, I was amazed at how lovely it was, not only was the lodge spotlessly clean we were surprised at all the complimentory things that were there all we needed were ourselves, food and clothing everything else was supplied including dressing gowns.. Bottle of wine if we wanted it, coffee and latte pods also Wifi.. The lodge was fast to warm up when we arrived back each day, There was a booklet explaining everything to do in the lodge, how to turn everything on and off, wifi password, dishwasher, pod machine however we never managed to master that one.
parking was just by the side of the lodge which made life much easier for me as I can only walk a few feet as i rely very much on wheelchair to get around. The site was fairly secure and really good that there were barriers in and out of it, my grandson loved the fact he memorised the code for our few days there.  The site was really peaceful, in fact we only saw one gentleman there walking a little dog in all the time we were there. What I did love was the birds early morning and evening singing away..  If we venture that way again this is where we are planning to stay again.  Well worth the stay.
showerReviews.author: Karen Rollinson
